column2: MGNF is a twoyear Certificate Programme that aims to create a cadre of individuals to strengthen the functioning of national and state institutions in design and management of effective skilling, training, and employment ecosystem.   The candidate will combine passion for development with high sense of accountability, drive for excellence, analytical abilities, and will be able to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders.      The Programme Manager will:       Work with the programme team at IIM Nagpur and coordinate with multiple stakeholders and Fellows spread across different districts     Manage and utilize resources for the programme through good budgeting and resource allocation practices     Communicate and coordinate with all stakeholders including State Research Associates (SRA), district administration, and other associates     Identify key requirements and serve as a liaison between the Programme Directors and SRAs and Fellows     Monitor programme delivery at both IIMN and District Office level to ensure achievement of programme goals     Carry out/Undertake evaluation and documentation of progress of programme and Fellows as required     Analyze, evaluate, and overcome programme risks and produce programme reports     Train, supervise, and evaluate support staff      Candidate may have to travel as per requirements.         Master s degree (Full time) in one of the following: management, business administration, public policy, economics, entrepreneurship preferably from reputed institutions.     Exceptional candidates without a postgraduate degree but with relevant experience may be considered.       Skills:       Proven ability to strategise and implement programme initiatives     Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of a high-performing team     Excellent written and oral communication skills including a demonstrated ability to prepare and deliver timely, accurate, and high-quality briefings, reports, and visual communications for a range of stakeholders     Demonstrated experience managing effective and constructive relationships with a range of internal and external stakeholders         At least 5 years experience in an advanced programme/project management role preferably in academia and/or development sectors in reputed organizations     Retired personnel with rich and relevant experience may apply.

column2: We have an incredible opportunity for a collaborative Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our Talent Team to build and support a world-class organisation and have a significant impact on the success and exponential growth of our company     You will partner with our People Leaders to develop a deep understanding of our business needs and the culture of the company to promote employment branding initiatives to attract top talent through the Talent Acquisition process     In this role you will provide hands-on specialist expertise across the full Talent Acquisition lifecycle, sourcing, identifying, managing the assessment process, through to the offer process to deliver unprecedented results across our organisation in Pune     We request that you are located in or near Pune, India to accommodate attendance in the office 3-5 days per week during general business hours.     This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in a high-tech company with a growing presence in the Asia Pacific Region.         What You Will Do             Partner with our People Leaders to identify talent gaps to meet current and future business need.         Plan, develop, and drive talent acquisition strategies, serving as a talent advisor to our People Leaders sharing best practices, and external and internal trends to attract top talent.         Be a brand ambassador and develop and share social media campaigns to attract top talent.         Internally communicate all employment opportunities to promote and drive peer referrals.         Identify, build, and maintain a pipeline of qualified talent through a variety of initiatives such as networking, resume databases, job advertisements, agencies, referrals and social networks which result in interviews with our People Leaders.         Coordinate with multiple stakeholders to ensure a seamless talent acquisition process; from raising a job req, through to managing an efficient, equitable, and professional assessment process, to seeking approvals to make an offer.         Partner with People Leaders to ensure comprehensive position descriptions and interview assessment guides are defined to support the selection of top talent.         Coordinate interview schedules across cross functional teams and time zones in a high-volume environment ensuring all panelists are interview ready and provide swift feedback.         Provide a superior level of candidate experience by respectfully evaluating role fit, providing swift feedback on the application/interview status and professionally managing offers negotiation.         Manage relationships with placement agencies, recruiters, job boards and job fairs for posting opportunities and sourcing candidates.         Main point of contact for third-party vendors, managing, recording, and processing invoices and procurement requests.         Monitor, update and leverage our Applicant Tracking System (ATS), Jobvite, to ensure data integrity.         Provide regular and timely information concerning hiring status to the business.         Create, maintain, and run weekly reports on trends, turnover rates, candidate feedback, taking appropriate actions on feedback and outcomes.         Attend to request from the business to support talent acquisition efforts across countries in APJ.     Contribute to HR goals, initiatives and other responsibilities as assigned to support our team s success.         What You Will Bring To Forescout             4+ years of talent acquisition experience.     Strong background in technical recruiting is required, in a tech/software industry preferred.         Strong technical knowledge of various HR Business Applications, LinkedIn Recruiter, Oracle, JobVite.     Strong program management, project management, vendor management, and overall operations experience.     Data driven approach with strong analytics skills and the ability to create, measure and scale the right workflows between new hires, People Leaders and supporting teams.         Demonstrated success in working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a professional demeanor and exercising tact and good judgment.         Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment.         Exceptional customer service and relationship management focus, including commitment to producing quality results, is essential.         Strong problem-solving skills, resourceful thinking, interpersonal skills with empathy to build rapport.         Strong communication, interpersonal, teamwork, administration, and analytical skills.         Self-directed, detail-oriented, problem solver who will fully execute on all tasks.         Ability to work with sensitive information and exhibit a high level of confidentiality.         Ability to work with multiple stakeholders and meet tight deadlines with a great attention to detail.         Ability to work across a variety of time zones and with remote leader as your manager and remote People Leaders that you will support who are not located in India.         A positive attitude paired with a passion for creating an engage workforce.     Bachelors degree in an applicable discipline such as Business or Human Resources

column2: We are seeking candidates for Associate positions on the GLG Client Solutions team in Gurugram      The team is responsible for managing and executing primary research deliverables to add value to GLG clients, globally      These primary research deliverables include phone consultations and one-on[1]one meetings, as well as surveys, reports, and site tours with leading experts and C-suite executives      Associates are front-line client service professionals and work closely with our clients -- professionals at the world s top management consulting firms, investment firms, corporations, and non-profits on the critical decisions they make every day      Client Solutions Associates work in teams across industries, connecting our clients to the insight they need from leading doctors, academics, scientists, policy specialists, strategists, executives and other experts with years of on-the-ground experience      The role entails partnering closely with Client Solutions team members from APAC and providing support on APAC-based client projects afterhours              ***This role is for evening/ night shift India Standard Time***            Specific responsibilities include (but are not limited to):    Facilitating educational interactions between GLG experts (Network Members) and our    clients, enable our clients to make more informed and confident investment decisions      The Associate is tasked with fulfilling time sensitive research requests by analysing client requests,    building and qualifying primary populations of topic experts, and working with internal partners to develop customized interactions for clients      Most GLG client/expert interactions consist of telephone consultations, but also may consist of in-depth engagements, in-person interaction, survey and tour, etc      Project support and management of custom solutions for clients, which includes, but not limited to project scoping, project set up, client and expert engagement, vetting and highlighting experts, project follow up, recruitment of new experts, and compliance      Enhancing GLG s expert network base: Develop and manage relationships with GLG s most respected experts who are thought leaders across sectors, as well as recruit new senior    executives and leading consultants into the GLG network through research, networking, and direct outreach      Team-wide collaboration: Work closely with our Asia-Pacific based Client Solutions team, as well as other functional professionals globally to develop customized products and solutions for GLG clients      Compliance: Navigate complex compliance requirements and operational procedures that differs across a wide pool of clients in daily project management, to protect the integrity of    client engagements              An ideal candidate will have the following:          2-4 years of experience, ideally in consulting, financial services, market research, recruiting, other professional services or start-up environment        Prior experience in B2B client management / servicing, especially international based clients        Postgraduate / Graduate degree from a top-tier university        Superior communication and interaction skills, including demonstrated oral, written and presentation abilities in a business-focused setting using a variety of communication channels (telephone, e-mail, in-person, etc)        General understanding, awareness and interest in consulting and financial markets        Demonstrated entrepreneurial/leadership skills.        Experience interacting with senior executives        Ability to work effectively independently and/or collaboratively in a team        Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively, while ensuring a high level of accuracy and attention to detail        Successful track record of working in a dynamic environment, often accompanied by stringent deadlines.

column1: Talent Acquisition Data Analyst & ATS Specialist
column2: Reporting Line            Global Head of Talent Acquisition            Purpose of the Role            This role is designed for a data-savvy individual passionate about enhancing recruitment strategies through technology and analytics. If you are eager to contribute to our team by driving efficiency and innovation in recruitment, we encourage you to apply.            Primary Responsibilities            The Recruitment Researcher is a pivotal role within our Talent Acquisition team, focusing on leveraging data analytics to improve recruitment strategies, maintaining and optimizing our SmartRecruiters (ATS), and supporting the overall recruitment process.            Specific Responsibilities            Data Analysis and Reporting: Utilize SmartRecruiters and other data sources to generate insights and reports. Analyze recruitment metrics to identify trends, efficiencies, and areas for improvement in the recruitment process.      ATS Management: Oversee the day-to-day management of SmartRecruiters, ensuring data integrity and system optimization. Regularly review and update recruitment processes within SmartRecruiters to enhance functionality and user experience.      Training and Communication: Develop and deliver training sessions for the TA/HR team and hiring managers on new features and best practices. Communicate updates and changes in recruitment processes and systems to all stakeholders.      Support Recruitment Processes: Assist in refining recruitment strategies and processes through a data-driven approach. Support the talent acquisition team with reporting needs, process optimization, and implementation of best practices.      Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with HR, hiring managers, and IT to ensure SmartRecruiters and other recruitment tools meet the evolving needs of the organization.      Innovation and Improvement: Proactively identify and suggest improvements to recruitment processes and strategies based on data insights. Stay abreast of latest trends and technologies in recruitment analytics and ATS functionalities.      Experience in supporting recruitment reporting and processes.      Familiarity with SaaS/PaaS technology businesses is a plus.      Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, with a keen interest in learning and development.        Qualifications                Education            Masters degree is desired or equivalent by experience.            Experience            At least 3-5 years of experience as a strategic/technical recruitment sourcer is essential.      Proven experience in a recruitment research or similar role, with a strong focus on data analysis and SmartRecruiters management.      Strong analytical skills and experience with recruitment metrics and reporting.      Ability to conduct online and pre-screening interviews.      Experience in supporting recruitment reporting and processes.      The ability to stay up to date with competitor information and market trends.            Required Skills            High-level analytical skills      Detail-oriented and strong investigation skills      Project management skills      Strong ability to manage multiple projects, priorities and ambiguity      Creativity and out-of-the-box thinking in devising and proposing new opportunities      Excellent collaborative and interpersonal skills      Determination and pro-activity      Eager to learn continuously and develop personal and technical capabilities      Ability to build knowledge and expertise within the team      Expert verbal and written communication skills in English; other languages are a plus      Demonstrated ability to work in a multicultural and diverse environment      Capacity to adapt to a highly dynamic environment
column11: Analytical skills, Stakeholder Engagement, Data analysis, Process optimization, Interpersonal skills, Talent acquisition, Project management, Manager Technology, Analytics, Recruitment

column2: Job Overview:    As an IT Recruiter, your primary responsibility will be to identify, attract, and hire top-tier IT talent to meet the staffing needs of clients. You will play a crucial role in building a strong team of technology professionals who align with our Client's objectives and culture.   The IT Recruiter will work closely with hiring managers and other stakeholders to understand staffing requirements and execute effective recruitment strategies.   Key Responsibilities:  Talent Acquisition: Source, screen, and evaluate candidates for IT positions through various channels, including online job portals, social media, networking events, and referrals. Build and maintain a robust pipeline of potential candidates to meet current and future hiring needs. Collaboration: Partner with hiring managers/ client SPOCs to understand technical requirements, team dynamics, and cultural fit for open positions. Collaborate with internal teams and client teams to create comprehensive job descriptions and specifications.  Interviewing and Evaluation: Assess candidates' skills, experience, and qualifications. Evaluate candidates' technical abilities, soft skills, and cultural fit for the organization.  Candidate Management: Provide a positive and professional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Keep candidates informed about their application status, interview feedback, and any additional steps in the hiring process.  Market Research: Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor practices, and emerging technologies to make informed decisions and maintain competitiveness in talent acquisition.  Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations in the recruitment process. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the applicant tracking system (ATS).  Reporting: Generate and analyse recruitment reports to assess the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and make data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement.  Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as an IT Recruiter or in a similar role within the technology industry. In-depth knowledge of IT roles, skills, and technologies. Strong understanding of recruitment processes and best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.  Preferred Qualifications: IT certifications or technical background. Experience in recruiting for diverse technical roles, such as software developers, system administrators, data analysts, etc.

Create and optimise staff schedules to ensure adequate coverage across all shifts, considering QA Tester skills, collaborative working practices across multiple time zones, peak game release times, holidays, and special events.      Monitor real-time QA work activities and staffing levels, adjusting schedules as necessary to meet internal and external service level agreements. Work with People Development to schedule training sessions for new hires and ongoing training for existing staff without impacting service levels.      Work with QA managers and People Development to ensure the ongoing measurement and mapping of QA Tester skills to ensure forecast work demands can always be met.      Analyse performance data to identify trends, efficiency opportunities, and areas for improvement in staffing, scheduling, and the use of automation within the QA processes.      Provide regular reporting on forecasting and scheduling accuracy.      Communicate effectively with team leaders and managers to ensure transparency and alignment on staffing requirements and changes.      Maintain a thorough understanding of all game publishing operations, policies, and procedures to make informed planning decisions.      Work collaboratively with department heads in support of the efficient sharing of game production schedules, QA work stack information, and QA key metrics. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.      Attention to detail and strong organizational skills. column2: This position will focus on hiring technical talent for our Bangkok and Bangalore offices and will partner closely with our local engineering teams. column2: As a Technical IT Recruiter, your primary responsibility will be to source, identify, and attract top IT talent to meet the organizations technical staffing needs. You will play a crucial role in building a strong and skilled IT workforce to support the companys technological initiatives and projects. Your expertise in sourcing and assessing candidates will be vital in ensuring the right fit for various technical positions within the company.        Key Responsibilities:        1. Talent Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing channels, such as job boards, social media, professional networks, referrals, and direct outreach, to identify and attract potential IT candidates.      2. Candidate Screening: Review and analyze IT candidates resumes and applications to assess their qualifications, skills, and experience. Conduct initial screenings and interviews to evaluate their technical expertise and cultural fit.      3. Interviewing and Assessment: Collaborate with technical managers and teams to understand specific job requirements and technical skillsets. Conduct in-depth technical interviews and skill assessments to evaluate candidates suitability for the role.      4. Applicant Tracking: Manage and maintain candidate data within the applicant tracking system (ATS) or recruitment software, ensuring accurate and up-to-date candidate records.      5. Candidate Engagement: Build and maintain relationships with prospective IT candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.      6. Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and emerging technologies to effectively target and attract top IT talent.      7. Collaborative Hiring: Collaborate with hiring managers and teams to understand their specific requirements, provide regular updates on recruitment progress, and align on candidate selection.      8. Offer Management: Extend job offers to selected candidates and handle negotiations, ensuring competitive compensation packages and a smooth onboarding process.      9. Data Analysis and Reporting: Utilize recruitment metrics and data analysis to track the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and optimize the recruitment process.        Requirements/Must Have Skills:          Proven work experience as a Technical IT Recruiter or similar role in the IT industry.      In-depth knowledge of various IT roles, technologies, and programming languages.      Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software.      Strong sourcing and networking skills to identify and engage with IT candidates.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships with candidates and hiring teams.      Ability to conduct technical interviews and assess candidates technical competencies.      Knowledge of HR and employment laws and regulations related to hiring.      High level of adaptability and the ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.      Bachelors degree in Human Resources, IT, or a related field is preferred.
column11: IT services, Data analysis, Automation, Managed services, Networking, Staffing, Social media, Healthcare, Market research, Operations

column2: Renewable Energy Recruiter - job offer in India Renewable Energy Recruiter Mumbai Job    Description    Renewable Energy Recruiter    As the team is expanding, we are seeking an English speaking Renewable Energy Recruiter (solar, wave, wind, geothermal, hydro, biomass) with a proven track record and experience in mid to senior level full cycle recruitment. You will build and grow both client and candidate relationships through management of the recruitment process delivery including: sourcing, screening, assessing, and presenting candidates to multinational clients. Career growth opportunities to build and manage a team of Recruiters and Researchers and expand into Latam/Asia/Europe for the ideal candidate.       The Role:         Researching, identifying and presenting candidates for mid to senior level positions in India spanning a range of diverse industries     Identifying recruitment sources, networking leads, social media opportunities, job fairs, advertising resources, and other tools to attract candidates     Client Candidate Relationship Management, conducting interactions in a timely, professional and responsive manner     Creating and updating Progress Reports to track research and recruitment process     Arrange and attend client meetings, create and write proposals and supporting RFI and RFP     Bachelor s degree in Business, Marketing, or related area         The Requirements:         2+ years experience in full cycle recruitment (job description creation, posting, sourcing, screening, interviewing, presenting closing)     Experience with a variety of sourcing methodologies to include: headhunting, market mapping, Boolean searches, social media recruitment strategies, career sites, among others     Interacting with clients (both local and international) and key stake holders throughout the recruitment process     Customer focus with a sense of urgency while maintaining quality control     Strong negotiation, verbal and written communication skills with attention to detail     Entrepreneurial spirit and driven for growth and expansion     Ability to work independently, strong team player and/ or manage international offices and Consultants

column2: Job Title: Sales and Recruiter (SAP and IT) Location:  Raidurgam, Hyderabad Position Type:  Full-time, Onsite Reporting Salary:  Competitive, based on experience Notice Period: Immediate Joiner Shift Timings - Rotational - 5 days working (Mng/Evening) Job Description: We are seeking an experienced Recruiter specializing in SAP and IT domains to join our team in Raidurgam, Hyderabad. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in hiring IT professionals in the SAP domain as well as General IT. This role requires excellent communication skills, the ability to work in US shift timings and a commitment to onsite reporting from Monday to Saturday. Must be a self starter and an independent contributor. Responsibilities : Identify and recruit qualified SAP and IT professionals for both U.S and Domestic Source candidates through various channels, including job portals, social media, referrals, and networking events. Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and evaluate candidates' qualifications and suitability for bench roles. Coordinate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and requirements. Build and maintain relationships with candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Provide regular updates to management on recruitment progress, including candidate pipelines and hiring metrics. Collaborate with team members to meet recruitment targets and goals. Mentor and supervise a team of at least 5 members, providing guidance and support as needed. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and legal regulations related to recruitment and staffing. Maintain accurate records of candidate interactions and recruitment activities in the applicant tracking system. Qualifications : MBA preferred or a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field is mandatory. Proven experience as a Recruiter who understands entire recruitment cycle, with a minimum of 7-8 years in IT recruitment. Strong understanding of the SAP domain and IT industry trends. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with a high level of proficiency in English. Ability to work in US shift timings and commit to onsite reporting from Monday to Friday. Demonstrated leadership skills, with experience in managing a team of recruiters. Results-oriented mindset with a focus on meeting recruitment targets and deadlines. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and adaptable approach to recruitment. Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and applicant tracking systems. Note:  This role does not offer remote work or hybrid options. The selected candidate must be willing to work from the office on-site. If you meet the qualifications outlined above and are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role in bench sales recruitment, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to our success in sourcing top talent for our SAP and IT bench positions.

Thorough understanding of the end-to-end recruitment process within the staffing industry or RPO  Experience in developing and maintaining positive relationships with key stakeholders. column2: Global Talent Acquisition Account Manager          Location: New Delhi  TackyMinds is a US based talent acquisition support firm whose role is to find full time talent for global companies around the world. Regions where we source include BRIC,  EMEA,  APAC and the Americas. We are looking for a seasoned Account Manager who can manager multiple global accounts. We are a rapidly growing global sourcing firms with clients all across the globe. Be prepared to manage clients in Italy,  Switzerland,  UK,  US,  Australia,  Singapore and even right home in India. You will be a great communicator who can manage client expectations and can work with the delivery team to ensure execution takes place. While a background in recruiting is preferred it is not mandatory. Typical delivery teams are made up of 3 to 5 recruiters/ sourcers. Each account has a dedicated delivery team attached to it which is managed by the team lead. As the owner of the account your role is to ensure the delivery team delivers as per client needs.     Role:   Manage and own multiple accounts.  Negotiate with delivery to ensure deliverables are met.  Manage client expectations.  Motivate,  provide direction and ensure client goals/ objectives are met.  Manage client expectations through regular communications.  Consult with the client to improve their talent acquisition process.     Required:   Minimum of 7+ years experience working in any industry.  Experience as an account manager with multiple accounts.   Great communication and negotiation skills.  Hard working,  strong work ethics. Does whatever it takes to get the work done.  Internet savvy and very comfortable with the use of technology.     Incentives:   Productivity incentives.  No night shifts.  Ability to work from home.  In the long run  -  possible travel to Europe/ US to meet happy clients!

column2: The talent Acquisition Team of any organization is the most important function of the organizations growth engine. At Brisa, we recognize how important this role is and that we need somebody with having a strong technical background to carry out this most important task in the growth process.         As we continue elevating our diversity and inclusion strategy at Brisa Technologies Pvt Ltd, we are excited to introduce our program that focuses on providing a platform for women returning to work after a career break to be a part of Brisa s Hiring team.         There is a number of reasons women take a break from their work. It can be forced due to circumstances or by their own choice especially due to Maternity, Relocation, or some challenging situations women are having Gap in their Job career.         Return-to-Work Program for women has been created as a platform to make women financially independent, emotionally strong, and socially empowered. Return-to-Work Program empowers women professionals at all levels. Join us, as we work with you to embark on an exciting journey of self-discovery and financial freedom. Benefits we have to offer you, there is a work from home option with the flexibility to work.         Brisas family will always encourage womens empowerment and provide more support to move one step forward.         Training will be provided.             Eligibility:             - Passion to return to work.         -Taking complete ownership.         -Willingness to work.         - Experience: 2 to 6 years in the technical field.         - Education: Graduate / Postgraduate.         -         Qualification:    BE, BCA, MCA(any technical graduate)

column2: Job Description :    Effectively source and recruit the best talent for our domestic as well as international operations through the diverse avenues like job portals,  campus tie- ups,  headhunting,  linked- in,  employee referrals etc. for tech as well as non tech roles within the given turn- around time    Adept with using a variety of recruiting technologies to source talent including social media,  campus set ups.    Efficiently track the manpower requirement trend and keep a pool ready for short term deployments -  Proactive or just in time hiring engagements.    To understand operations requirements for the given job/ skill set and design the Job description as per the specifications shared.    Build and Strengthen the market research,  pipeline building activities,  proactive engagement process with active and passive candidate pool    Develop recruitment strategy. This may include job posting optimization,  recruiting marketing channel development,  job board procurement,  digital and non- digital employment marketing,  comprehensive recruitment campaign planning,  talent planning,  etc.    Effectively map compensation basis compensation survey reports (provided by the organization) and also conduct internal compensation and benefit surveys basis market analysis.    Ensuring touch points maintained with the potential employees till the joining day to avoid last minute regrets.    Identify future talent needs and proactively recruiting and sourcing; develop talent pool or social engagements   Manage the recruitment process and life- cycle,  including initial assessments,  interviews,  and offers   Counsel the candidate on corporate benefits,  salary,  and corporate environment   Provide recruitment counsel and guidance to hiring managers and HR professionals with hiring and employment data.    May develop specialized or competitive intelligence and research in regards to talent development or retention.    Use social media,  job boards,  Internet sourcing,  and other technical means to source candidates for open jobs.    Participate in employment events,  such as career fairs   Stakeholder Management / Client Interaction    Managing end to end discussions; starting from manpower requisition- till closure,  budgeting.    Follow- up s on feedback,  setting up the recruitment process and the guidelines to be followed,  ensuring end to end closure so as to avoid any areas of opportunities   Working with different Account Manager s/  Business Owners so as to understand the business requirements and deliver on the set date/ deadlines & Quality   Be a part of hiring for different Pilot programs.    Be a part of Trainings and trained by Business Head s / Clients involved in understanding the potential work culture of the Candidates to be recruited; so as to identify the best possible resource   Vendor Management    From sourcing the requirement to the timely disbursal of payments,  ensuring checks on the D.O.J to the invoicing and the updating of vendor Contracts. column2: The Recruitment Specialist will play a key role in advancing L.E.K. Consulting s talent acquisition agenda and results for sourcing and hiring top talent. This position will be responsible for identifying, attracting and hiring candidates through campus recruitment across India; and collaborating with global peers to hire from international schools. In addition, the recruiter will facilitate our experienced lateral hiring by building and maintaining strong relationships with candidates, internal and external stakeholders.      The Recruitment Specialist will be the key contact for candidates throughout the full recruitment cycle, leading and managing the candidate screening and selection process for internships and full-time positions. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing firm with a high performance culture and the ability to make a significant and immediate impact.     This position will be based out of L.E.K. s Mumbai office.     Key Relationships:   Directly reports to: Recruitment Manager   Additional reporting relationships: Head of Talent, SEA     Major Responsibilities:   The major responsibilities of the Recruitment Specialist role will focus on, but may not be limited to, the following activities:       Campus Recruitment:       o Plan, manage, and facilitate recruitment events on campus and in the office by partnering with campus contacts and our firm s representatives to staff the events   o Point of contact for all logistics and administration organisation and support in the lead up to recruitment days       Lateral Recruitment:       o Leverage all aspects of sourcing and candidate development including job posting, job board mining, internet sourcing, social networking, employee referrals, and networking events   o Continuously and proactively build a solid pipeline of applicants for all roles   Candidate Experience   o Ensure an impressive candidate experience through thorough communication timely feedback, as well as interviewer preparedness and effective interview format   o Serve as the primary point of contact for candidates, educational institutions and the business   o Work closely with internal stakeholders to establish and/or design a tailored recruiting approach at designated school(s) to achieve demand   o Leverage recruiting knowledge, recruitment results and competitive market intelligence to drive strategies and influence key internal stakeholders on recruitment activities and programs   Reporting:   o Tracks and monitors analytics throughout the complete recruiting cycle to analyze and leverage data for the identification of trends and the adjustment of strategies/activities to improve results.   o Collaborate with recruiting team and internal stakeholders on the development of new recruiting strategies   Stay up to date with recruitment trends by leveraging a strong network and conducting industry research     Candidate Requirements:       Proven ability to think strategically, translate strategies into actionable plans, develop performance metrics and analyze results       Highly charismatic with excellent interpersonal communication skills.   Experience with designing and conducting interviews.   Good judge of character and decision-making skills.   Great networking abilities.   Sound knowledge of recruitment practices and keeping up to date with trends.   Ability to collaborate effectively with the team   A passion to learn and excel   A high level of professionalism, enthusiasm, and a positive team player   A sense of urgency to deliver for the business while also effectively working together as part of a team   In-depth direct sourcing expertise utilizing a range of methods and sources.     Candidate Qualifications   Strong understanding of concepts of Human Resource Management   Previous experience in a professional services environment, with experience at a consulting/ advisory firm preferred but not necessary   Minimum 3 years of relevant experience   Track record of effectively collaborating with others   Effective written and oral communications skills   Familiarity and experience with Excel

Brief about the Company   Touch Consultants is a Leading Talent Acquisition/ Recruitment Firm based out of Delhi. We have a strong team of recruiters. Currently hiring for 50+ branded MNC companies in various sectors on PAN INDIA basis. We are hiring in almost all sectors (IT , International BPO, Edtech, US Healthcare , BFSI etc) for Bulk and Leadership hiring. A comfortable and rewarding place to work for performers who are looking to learn & grow. (Please visit on www.touchconsultants.com for company details ) Multiple Openings 1. HR Recruiter (Bulk Hiring ) Location - Work From Office (West Delhi Next to Tilak Nagar Metro Station blue line) Please Note :- Preferably  'IMMEDIATE JOINERS' or "Maximum notice of 15 days  PLEASE APPLY ONLY IF YOU MEET THE BELOW MENTIONED ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. Eligibility Criteria (mandatory) Freshers or 0-3 yrs of experience in Volume hiring for MNC BPO's (Bulk hiring) Should have own Laptop and mobile Very Good Communication skills in English Language Knowledge of Microsoft excel Job Description  End to End Recruitment including Sourcing of profiles from various mediums  Making trackers and end to end followup & Coordination with candidate Daily minimum 6-7 lineups as per JD. Compensation 1) Compensation 15k- 17k for freshers &  2) 18k - 25k for experienced candidates based on skill & Experience Timings 10 am - 7 pm (Monday to Saturday)  ***Please watsapp your CV before calling to Rahul (contact number 9289129609)*** Touch Consultants (www.touchconsultants.com)(India's leading Talent Solutions firm) (Please note incase we are unable to connect through call then please watsapp on the given number) touch.hr1@touchconsultants.com or info.touch2020@gmail.com

column2: The Talent Acquisition is primarily responsible for recruitment efforts in the ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and IT sectors of Aeries.         This role demands a deep understanding of the ERP and IT landscapes, latest technologies, and the specific nuances of recruiting in these fields.               Key Responsibilities:                 ?         1. ERP and IT Recruitment Strategy:           Develop a specialized recruitment strategy to attract top talent in the ERP and IT sectors.         Stay updated on the latest ERP modules and IT developments to anticipate hiring needs.               ?         2. Candidate Sourcing and Engagement:           Identify potential candidates through various channels including job portals, networking events, and referrals.         Engage potential candidates with an understanding of technical requirements such as SAP, Oracle, cloud technologies, programming languages, and more.               ?         3. Stakeholder Collaboration:           Work closely with IT and ERP department heads to define precise hiring needs and specifications.               ?         4. Candidate Assessment:           Conduct preliminary screening and technical assessments, ensuring candidates meet the technical and cultural fit for roles.         Coordinate technical tests and interviews with the respective teams.               ?         5. Market Intelligence:           Stay informed about market trends, competitive salaries, and benefits to attract and retain the best talent in the ERP and IT sectors.               ?       Continually refine recruitment processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.               ?         7. Candidate Experience:           Ensure a seamless experience for candidates from the initial approach through the onboarding process.         Address any specific concerns related to ERP and IT roles.           ?         8. Compliance and Documentation:           Ensure that the hiring process complies with all regulatory standards.         Maintain proper documentation of candidates, especially regarding technical assessments.               ?         Desired Minimum Qualification:             Bachelors degree         A minimum of [     6     to 1     2     ] years of experience in talent acquisition with a focus on ERP and IT roles.         Strong understanding of ERP systems (like SAP, Oracle) and IT technologies.         Proven track record in hiring for technical roles.

column2: The ITES recruiter, reporting into the HR Department, will identify Ideal Team Players to join our team.          The responsibilities of a recruiter include working with leadership to identify the future hiring needs, designing job descriptions, sourcing candidates through recruiting platforms, social media & campus recruiting, conducting interviews, and completing necessary paperwork.              The Responsibilities:            Source candidates using a variety of search methods to build a robust candidate pipeline      Screen candidates by reviewing resumes and job applications, and performing phone screenings      Develop job postings, job descriptions, and position requirements      Perform reference checks as need      Facilitate the offer process by extending the offer and negotiating employment terms      Manage onboarding and new hire process      Stay abreast of recruiting trends and best practices      Work with team to manage overall interview, selection, and closing process      Working with Hiring Managers to identifying future hiring needs            Additional Position Information:            Full Time position      Onsite      Location: HYDE/HYDW      Core Hours: As per business requirement, core hours 8 hours per day/one hour break      Core Days Worked: Monday - Friday            The Desired Attributes:            Bachelor s Degree, emphasis in HR preferred      3 years experience in End-End Recruitment working with BPO hiring      Working knowledge of interview techniques and applicant screening methods      Experience with recruitment processes and databases.      Working knowledge & experience on Job Portals/ & other social media      Expertise in Job Posting/ Mass Mail/ Boolean Search      Expertise in sourcing methodologies bulk hiring through Campus recruitments      Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing (English required)      Excellent organizational and time management skills      Comfortable making decisions independently      Working knowledge of applicant tracking and HRIS systems            The Benefits:            Competitive Pay      Healthy work Culture      Career Growth Opportunities      Learning and Development Opportunities      Company Sponsored Health Insurance      Referral Award Program      Company Provided IT Equipment

column1: Non-IT Recruiter | Freshers & Experienced | Night Shift-Mohali
column2: Jr. Recruiter/Recruiter   Non-IT US Staffing   SPECTRAFORCE was founded in 2004 and is now one of the largest staffing firms in the United States. We set up operations and support staffing in India to better serve many of the US-based industries of which SPECTRA FORCE  clients are a part, including Finance, IT, Energy/Utilities, Pharma/Life Sciences, and Business and Professional Services. Our world-class Indian team is essential to the continuous expansion of our global sales and delivery. A Global Staffing and IT company, SPECTRAFORCE is human-to-human driven. Its branding tagline, NEWJOBPHORIA, encompasses the excitement generated within people by matching them with jobs that align on multiple levels: skills, motivation, and environment. As a certified Minority Business Enterprise, SPECTRAFORCE celebrates how different perspectives benefit our employees, services, and community. We focus on cultivating a diverse and inclusive work environment that encourages collaboration and connection. Together, these unique perspectives bring great offerings that deliver state-of-the-art services to our clients and employees.   The Recruiter will join our team in India. This person must be confident and willing to jump into a fast-paced and ambitious environment, where they will be given the opportunity to work independently and take ownership of various initiatives. This is a unique opportunity to work with one of the fastest-growing staffing companies and be a part of an energetic, dedicated, and passionate team.   Key Responsibilities: Responsible for full life cycle recruiting including direct sourcing activities, preliminary phone interviewing, and negotiation of compensation packages. Recruiting through Internet job portals combined with utilizing existing candidate relationships and referrals, along with various Internet sourcing techniques. Screening candidates based on the resource managers job description, relevant knowledge, and experience for required skill sets, functional skills, and communication skills. Regular follow-up from first Contact till the offer letter is extended to the candidate. Coordinate salary expectations, counteroffers, benefits, and interviews. Reference check for the candidate to ensure their authenticity and relevance. Responsible for sourcing, screening, and interviewing candidates, checking references, and updating job boards.     Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes: Flexible & Aggressive. Excellent communication skills (Spoken and Written). Work independently with little supervision in a fast-paced agency environment. Have a knack for learning and staying up to date with new technologies. Professional, Adaptable, and Resilient - able to take no for an answer yet still apply 100% effort throughout the workday. Goal-oriented; have a burning desire to be successful. Advanced computer skills especially Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, and Outlook. A highly motivated individual, able to grasp complex technologies, tools, or knowledge and learn quickly. Must have a demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines. Willing to work night shifts.    Benefits & Perks: Incentives* Monetary Awards* 5-Year Retention Bonus Referral Policy* Internet Reimbursement* Router UPS Reimbursement* Term Life Insurance Accidental Insurance Group Medical Insurance (Family Floater) On-call doctor support  COVID Protocols Sodexo Benefit Leave Policy EWAP - Employee Wellbeing and Assistance Program NPS - National Pension Scheme LTA Leave Travel allowance  Leave Encashment Bank Assistance Employee's State Insurance* Gratuity Provident Fund Cab facility   *Admissibility of the benefit may vary commensurate the department, designation, and role.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Human Resources Executiveto join our team. This role will play a crucial role in aligning human resources strategies with business objectives, fostering a positive work environment, and driving employee engagement and performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR management, a deep understanding of the home loan industry, and exceptional interpersonal skills.  Role & responsibilities     Strategic HR Planning:  Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies that support the company's goals and objectives. Provide insights and recommendations on workforce planning, talent acquisition, and organizational development. Employee Relations:  Serve as a trusted advisor to managers and employees on HR-related issues, including performance management, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions. Foster a culture of open communication, fairness, and mutual respect. Talent Acquisition and Management:  Partner with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Lead the recruitment process for key positions, ensuring the attraction and retention of top talent. Implement initiatives for onboarding, training, and career development. Performance Management:  Oversee the performance management process, including goal setting, performance reviews, and feedback mechanisms. Provide coaching and support to managers in conducting performance evaluations and addressing performance issues. Employee Engagement and Retention:  Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Conduct regular surveys and assessments to gather feedback and identify areas for improvement. Recommend and implement programs and policies to promote a positive work culture. HR Compliance:  Stay updated on relevant employment laws and regulations. Ensure compliance with legal requirements in all HR practices, policies, and procedures. Partner with the legal team as needed to address compliance issues. HR Metrics and Analytics:  Utilize HR data and analytics to track key metrics, trends, and insights. Generate reports and dashboards to inform decision-making and measure the effectiveness of HR programs and initiatives. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 5 years of experience in HR management & Talent Acquisition, preferably in the financial services or home loan industry. Proven track record of success in partnering with business leaders to drive HR initiatives and achieve organizational goals. Strong understanding of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Proficiency in HRIS, MS Office Suite, and other relevant software applications. Perks and benefits  : As per Industry Standard. Interested candidates should submit their resume atul.verma@muthothomefin.com.
column11: HRBP, Talent Acquisition, HR Strategy, Talent Management, Business HR, Employee Retention

column2: 1. Recruitment and Staffing: - Coordinate the recruitment process, including job postings, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making hiring recommendations. - Collaborate with department heads to understand staffing needs and ensure timely fulfillment of positions. 2. On boarding and Orientation: - Facilitate the on boarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization. - Conduct orientation programs to familiarize new employees with company policies, culture, and procedures. 3. Employee Relations: - Act as a liaison between employees and management, addressing concerns, and promoting a positive work environment. - Implement and enforce HR policies and procedures. 4. Performance Management: - Support the performance appraisal process by assisting in goal setting, conducting performance reviews, and identifying development opportunities. - Provide guidance on performance improvement plans as needed. 5. Training and Development: - Identify training needs and coordinate training programs for employees. - Promote continuous learning and development to enhance employee skills and capabilities. 6. Employee Engagement: - Organize and participate in employee engagement initiatives, such as team-building activities, events, and recognition programs. - Foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture. 7. Benefits Administration: - Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. - Address employee queries related to benefits and facilitate open enrollment processes. 8. HR Metrics and Reporting: - Compile and analyze HR metrics to assess the effectiveness of HR programs and initiatives. - Prepare regular reports for management on key HR performance indicators. 9. Compliance and Legal: - Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies. - Handle employee relations issues and legal matters in collaboration with legal counsel. 10. Conflict Resolution: - Mediate conflicts between employees and provide guidance on conflict resolution. - Implement strategies to maintain a positive and harmonious work environment. Skills and Qualifications: 1. Communication Skills: - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 2. Interpersonal Skills: - Ability to build positive relationships with employees at all levels. 3. Problem-Solving: - Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to address employee issues effectively. 4. Confidentiality: - Maintain confidentiality in handling sensitive HR information. 5. Organizational Skills: - Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. 6. Adaptability: - Ability to adapt to changes in priorities and work in a dynamic environment. 7. Team Collaboration: - Collaborate with other departments to achieve organizational goals. 8. Knowledge of Employment Laws: - Understanding of relevant labor laws and regulations. 9. Tech-Savvy: - Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and other HR-related tools. 10. Empathy: - Demonstrated empathy and understanding of employee needs and concerns.

column2: Skill required:  User-Generated Content Moderation - Content Moderation Designation:  Trust & Safety New Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? Accenture is a trusted, innovative, comprehensive, and experienced partner to leading platform companies. The Trust and Safety offering within Accenture Operations helps keep the internet safe and helps platform companies accelerate, scale, and improve their businesses.Content moderators serve as an important line of defence by helping improve the quality and safety of online content while gaining hands-on job experience. You will deliver value to our clients, while makinga larger impact on society.You will be responsible for analysing and reviewing user profiles, audio, videos, and text-based content and/or investigating, escalating and/or resolving issues that are reported by users or flagged by the system. Due to the nature of the role, the user may be exposed to flashing lights or contrasting light and dark patterns.Content moderation is meaningful work that helps keep the internet safe. It may also be challenging, at times. In the context of this role, individuals may be directly or inadvertently exposed to potentially objectionable and sensitive content (e.g., graphic, violent, sexual, or egregious). Therefore, content moderators need strong resilience and coping skills. We care for the health and well-being of our people and provide the support and resources needed to perform their job role responsibilities. Active participation in Accenture's well-being support program, designed specifically for the Trust & Safety community, provides valuable skills to promote individual and collective well-being. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible Ability to establish strong client relationship Commitment to quality Ability to meet deadlines  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

(Comp) ,  MCA Mention the job title in the subject field for quick consideration. Welcome to www.indianpetroplus We value creativity ,  tenacity and teamwork.    You will be given the opportunity to work hard ,  develop critical thinking skills and learn the nuances of building strong ,  professional relationships.   Your performance and initiative are the deciding factors for your future growth. Our tasks span geographies and industries ,  ranging from simple to complex assignments.   Our work is focused entirely on our clients' needs. You develop your competencies across multiple service areas ,  while gaining in - depth understanding of your core principle. Life with us is as challenging as it is rewarding.   Whatever your core area of expertise ,  you will gain in experience and learn the craft of analytics and business. You can develop rapidly as you take on a steady stream of new and complex challenges.   You will work on increasingly challenging assignments ,  lead project teams ,  advise clients and assume leadership roles within teams.   At any level ,  you will find yourself advising ,  managing ,  problem solving and building solutions. Discussions will be across the board ,  with the team ,  your team leaders and clients ,  as you interface every requirement and dispense necessary solutions.   What we expect from you    We expect you not just to accomplish your goals but also to set an example for your peers. We cherish innovative thinking and commitment ,  and we welcome individuals who believe in themselves and in our vision.   At Indianpertoplus you will be offered truly distinctive opportunities.   We are a fast growing organization and you will be trained and motivated to deliver your best. A majority of our workforce has been groomed in - house and offers expert guidance.   You will be valued for your originality ,  and your creativity will be nurtured to bring forth personal and professional growth. In turn we will boost your professional expertise.   If you want a culture of open communication and a commitment to quality ,  work with us. We inculcate collaboration across disciplines and flexibility in every approach. We have built a reputation of impeccable professional ethics ,  and we welcome individuals who thrive on meeting challenges.   At Indianpertoplus you will be trained for outstanding performance. From day one your training will be customized to your role competencies and business requirements ,  and it will be designed to develop your skills to the fullest.   You will work with clients to define the problem and determine the best approach. You will partner with leaders ,  head project teams and ultimately chart a career path that will define your experience and learning process.   Continuous ,  long term training    You will also be taken through job rotation ,  individual development plans and special projects to give your every opportunity to groom your competencies.   The overriding goal is to create a partnership between you and Indianpertoplus so that you can create value for yourself ,  keep your skills up to date and fully develop your capabilities. column2: We are looking for a Sourcing Specialist to join our growing Corporate Recruiting team. In this role, you will leverage various sourcing channels to build a strong talent pipeline for Artech s current and future hiring needs. This entails formulation and execution of various sourcing strategies to attract passive as well as active talent pool of candidates, for open jobs and passing-on the leads for interested candidates to the Corp Recruiting team so that they can screen them further for the various open jobs.                          Responsibilities                           Focus primarily on sourcing, attracting, and engaging passive prospects for Artech s US offices, specifically for recruiting and sales roles.                 Approaching passive candidates and convince them to pursue an open position.                 Leverage platforms including LinkedIn, Job Diva, Careerbuilder, Indeed and social media to actively engage top prospects and build awareness for job opportunities with Artech                     Build relationships with individuals and with pools of talent in support of current and future hiring needs                     Proactively network for referrals that will identify additional talent for the firm.                     Expertise in both traditional and advanced talent sourcing techniques including full proficiency with Boolean search tactics.                     Build a pipeline of qualified candidates through researching, prospecting, and active networking using various sourcing channels such as external resume databases, social media, alumni networks, professional organizations, and referrals.                     Collaborate with team members to create innovative sourcing and recruitment strategies.                     Keeps Job Diva - Applicant Tracking System (ATS) updated at all times                     Submit candidates to the corporate recruiting team for further qualification and interest in available opportunities.                       Simultaneously manage multiple searches and support multiple recruiting partners                   Understanding ongoing hiring needs of their business and establishing the right sourcing mix to generate a strong pool of talent for open roles.             Drafting publishing attractive job advertisement and managing responses.                 Performs other administrative tasks as needed                               Qualifications                             Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field.                         1+ year of progressive recruiting experience, preferably in a consulting or agency environment.                         Demonstrated experience in creating and executing creative sourcing strategies for active and passive talent through various sourcing channels such as: LinkedIn Recruiter, Indeed, social media, professional organizations, etc.                         Demonstrated ability to drive results, must possess strong execution skills, and a willingness to work on tactical and routine tasks.                         Well versed with Applicant Tracking Systems, preferably Job Diva.                         Work collaboratively on teams and consult effectively and independently with all levels of the organization.                         Must feel comfortable working in a Night Shift (EST).                         Must be detail oriented, self-directed, excellent follow-through, and the ability to multi-task.                         Excellent verbal and written communication skills.                         Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

column2: Aspire is  dedicated to delivering top-notch talent acquisition and workforce solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are currently seeking a dynamic and skilled Recruiter to join our Recruitment team. If you are passionate about finding the right talent and thrive in a fast-paced, client-focused environment, we want to hear from you. Position :  IT Recruiter / Sr It Recruiter  NON IT / Sr NON IT recruiter  Team Lead - NON IT HIRING  Job Summary:  As a Recruiter working with our recruitment team, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and delivering high-quality candidates to meet the staffing needs of our clients. You will act as a bridge with our clients , ensuring that we provide the best-fit candidates for their positions. This role requires a strong understanding of client requirements, effective communication with both clients and vendors, and the ability to build lasting relationships. Key Responsibilities: Client Management: Develop and maintain relationships with Clients Collaborate with clients to understand client job requirements and expectations. Monitor performance and provide feedback for continuous improvement. Candidate Sourcing and Screening: Source candidates through various channels, including vendor networks, job boards, and social media. Conduct thorough interviews and assessments to evaluate candidate qualifications and fit for client roles. Present shortlisted candidates to clients and vendors. Client Communication: Act as the main point of contact for clients, understanding their hiring needs and priorities. Communicate regularly with clients to provide updates on candidate status and progress. Address client inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally. Quality Control: Ensure the quality of candidates presented to clients, including thorough background checks and reference verifications. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate and client records in the company's ATS. Compliance and Reporting: Stay informed about employment laws and regulations relevant to recruitment and staffing. Generate and present regular reports on recruitment activities and vendor performance. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, or a related field (preferred). Proven experience as a recruiter or in a similar role, with a strong track record of successful placements. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Strong understanding of recruitment strategies and techniques. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software. Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills. Knowledge of labor laws and regulations related to recruitment. How to Apply:  If you are a passionate recruiter with a talent for building relationships, and you're ready to contribute to the success of our clients and company, please submit your resume

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION:   If you have the passion to work with people and are excited by the thought of collaborating with an  international audience, making a difference in peoples lives around the world, and of course growing your  career in the HR Recruitment space, you should interview with us.  JOB SUMMARY:  The key focus for a Recruiter is to execute sourcing strategies and plans with a focus on passive candidates,  with the aim of achieving high quality, cost-effective and timely filling of roles. You will work closely with the  Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders to recommend and develop a sourcing strategy. Based  on your experience, you will recommend enhancements to ensure recruitment strategy effectiveness and  will initiate and drive best-practice sourcing strategies  Your duties may include, but are not limited to:  Responsible for identifying talent that meets specific client requirements.   Build a strong working relationship with Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders.  Understanding & analyzing the requirement of the position based on clients specifications.  Utilize a variety of recruiting strategies to focus on direct sourced (passive) candidates.  Involved in sourcing profiles through job portals, internal databases, and professional networking.   Utilize the internal database to identify potential candidates and post jobs on the portals to increase  the pool of candidates.  Call potential candidates in the US and discuss the job openings.   Provide exceptional candidate care and ensure that candidates are effectively pre-screened before.  Select and qualify candidates based on skill, cultural, and motivational fit, utilizing behavioral-based  Approach and screening criteria.  Maintain timely and accurate information on all candidate interactions.  Proactively pipeline talent and create pre-qualified candidate talent pools in line with the clients  QUALIFICATION:  Bachelors degree. (For recent under-graduates: They should have all the semesters original mark  sheets. No active backlogs)  The average of 10th, 12th (PUC), and UG marks percentage should be more than 60%.  Ability to learn and adapt to working on newer skills and requirements demands.  Possess strong written and oral English communication skills.  Ability to recruit with a sense of urgency.  Availability to work before/after typical office hours as work may necessitate.  A strong work ethic and sense of commitment.  Ability to work under pressure and target-driven environment  PERKS AND BENEFITS:    Both-way Cab (Free Door Pickup and Drop)   Within a 14 Km radius of the work  location.   5 days Working   Medical Insurance.   Uncapped Incentives based on each Hire.

column2: HR Executive job duties include:  An HR Executive Job requires one to handle directing and overseeing significant processes like hiring, training, and dismissal.   They also have to monitor as well as administer the various benefit programs.   Human Resource Executives may work in coordination with the CEO to plan and implement strategically valuable changes to the HR.   Strong organisational, interpersonal, and analytical skills are a prerequisite for an HR Executive Job.   An HR Executive is required to have a direct connection to the employees and must ensure healthy employee relations and a healthy environment for them throughout the organisation.  Direct or make necessary updates to the various health plans, benefits, retirement plans, etc.  Ensure proper manager and employee relationships and coordination.  They must be aware of the climate of the company and try to make it as positive as they can. This also includes boosting employee morale from time to time.  Have regular meetings with employees and several other individuals in the organisation and get progress reviews and assessments. An HR Executive job also requires one to be vigilant in terms of discussing various problems, if any, or grievances that the individuals in a company may have.   Have a thorough understanding of pertinent labour laws and adhere to them.  Coordinate and direct numerous work activities to aid managers and employees  Management and supervision of other HR staff also comes under the jurisdiction of an HR Executive. They must ensure that the entire staff is assigned proper tasks and carries out the said tasks.  Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: About the role As an  Executive/Senior Executive, Talent Acquisition at IndoBevs, you will be responsible for recruiting the right candidate for all domains and verticals within the organization.  This is an individual contributor role and you must be able to successfully execute hiring priorities, and manage and close positions against a timeline. What you will do day to day?   Screening      resumes, performing telephonic & F2F interviews with candidates Administering appropriate company assessments including online tests, case- studies,      etc. Performing  reference and background checks Partnering  with hiring managers to determine staffing needs and making      recommendations to company hiring managers Coordinating   interviews with the hiring managers and following up on the interview      process status Maintaining relationships with both internal and external clients to ensure recruitment targets are achieved What are we looking for? Minimum Qualification: Graduation/ Post Graduation in HR or relevant 1-3 years of experience.  Experience in end-to-end recruitment would be an added advantage Candidates with Bulk/ Mass hiring experience would be preferred. Excellent  communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills Demonstrated  ability to work in a dynamic and intense environment as a team member

column2: We are based out of  Wework , Oberoi Commerz II in Goregaon East. Job Title: Associate / Sr. Associate - Search & Recruitment  Working Days : 5 Days (Monday to Friday) Job Summary:   As an Associate - Search & Recruitment, at Keytaal Worldwide, you will be an integral part of our dynamic team, contributing to the end-to-end recruitment process for our diverse clientele. Your role will involve candidate sourcing, screening, and initial engagement, as well as administrative support to ensure a seamless and successful recruitment experience. By collaborating with senior recruiters and learning from their expertise, you will develop essential skills and knowledge in the field of recruitment. Key Responsibilities: ??Collaborate with senior recruiters to understand client requirements and position specifications. ??Source potential candidates using various methods such as online job boards, social media, and database searches. ??Screen candidate resumes and applications to assess qualifications, experience, and cultural fit. ??Conduct preliminary phone/in-person/video interviews to evaluate candidate suitability and interest in job opportunities. ??Assist in coordinating and scheduling interviews between candidates and clients. ??Maintain accurate and organized candidate MIS in Keytaal formats. ??Prepare candidate profiles and summaries for client presentation. ??Assist in conducting reference checks and background screenings as part of the screening process. ??Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in recruitment.  Qualifications and Skills:    Any Graduate with 0-5 years experience   Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.   Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail.   Proficiency in Microsoft Office.   Enthusiastic and eager to learn about the HR and recruitment.   Willingness to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.  Preferred Qualifications:    Previous internship or work experience in recruitment, human resources, or related fields.   Familiarity with recruitment tools for candidate sourcing like Naukri, LinkedIn, Shine, Monster etc   Knowledge of candidate assessment techniques.
