column2: As an Associate, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level     include but are not limited to:             Use feedback and reflection to develop self-awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.         Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities and coach to help deliver results.         Develop new ideas and propose innovative solutions to problems.         Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current trends in business area.         Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.         Share relevant thought leadership.         Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing others.         Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality, diverse relationships.         Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.               Preferred Knowledge/ Skills:         Basic Qualifications    - Bachelors or Masters degree/ Specialization in Human Resources is an preferred         Demonstrates working-level knowledge of, and/or proven record of success with Campus recruiting /sourcing strategy development and execution, preferably for a global network of professional services firms, including the following areas:         Understanding and utilizing recruiting systems, technologies and protocols;         Collaborating with sourcing professionals, hiring leaders, and business stakeholders;         Contributing to full candidate life-cycle candidate recruitment and relationship building;             Demonstrates ability and related functional know-how to drive the following results related to the firms Campus recruiting lifecycle, including the following areas: -         Contributing to the development of pan India business unit Campus recruiting strategy for assigned requisitions;         Maintaining pipeline reports and presenting regular updates to key stakeholders;         Identifying and recommending candidates, coordinating interview scheduling, negotiating offers, and bringing the candidate recruiting process to closure;         Building working relationships with local partners, staff, and HR colleagues related to recruiting efforts;         Managing and updating the Applicant Tracking System, for candidate progression in the interview process on a real-time basis;         Supporting pan India Recruiting Manager(s) with requisitions, as needed;         Managing unsolicited and generic referrals as needed;         Managing special projects at the pan India level;         Responding to routine recruiting-related questions from partners, staff, candidates, and new hires; and,         Providing coaching and guidance to recruiting associates as needed. Prior experience of performing roles within a business in the professional services industry is preferred.             Demonstrates thorough level knowledge of and proven ability to contribute consistently and positively in a high-paced, changing work environment, emphasizing the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, as well as manage time efficiently in a recruiting/research role, which includes, but is not limited to, the following areas:         Contributing to the development of pan India business unit campus recruiting strategies for assigned requisitions;         Conducting in-depth searches to find targeted candidate populations, including computer search, job board web research techniques, networking and cold calling/phone research and utilizing social media;         Performing deep web sourcing, utilizing advanced filtering and Boolean search strings, and database mining;         Tracking industry trends and developments, including information on competitors to include analyzing talent trends and hiring developments within sectors to bring value added insight and perspective to internal stakeholders;         Managing and updating the Applicant Tracking System and the candidate relationship manager, for candidate progression in the interview process on a real-time basis; and,         Supporting special projects at the pan India level.                       Minimum Degree Required:    Bachelors or Masters degree/ Specialization in Human Resources is an preferred           Minimum Years of Experience: 0-1    years experience in IT or Non IT Recruitment           Preferred Qualifications   :    Preferred Fields of Study   : NA           Certification(s) Preferred   : NA

column2: Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Talent Acquisition Executive to join our dynamic team. The Talent Acquisition Executive will be responsible for attracting, sourcing, and recruiting top talent to meet the organization's staffing needs. This role requires a proactive approach, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to build strong relationships with candidates and internal stakeholders. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates. Source potential candidates through online channels, job boards, social media, networking, and other creative methods. Screen resumes and applications, conduct initial phone screenings, and schedule interviews. Coordinate and participate in interview processes, including panel interviews, technical assessments, and behavioral interviews. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop job descriptions and specifications. Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline by proactively engaging with passive candidates and building relationships with potential hires. Manage candidate communication throughout the recruitment process, providing timely updates and feedback. Conduct reference checks and background screenings for selected candidates. Utilize Applicant Tracking System (ATS) to manage recruitment activities, track candidate progress, and generate recruitment reports. Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and legal requirements related to recruitment and talent acquisition. Assist in employer branding initiatives and recruitment marketing campaigns to enhance the organization's reputation as an employer of choice. Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by providing feedback on recruitment processes and suggesting areas for optimization. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist, Recruiter, or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Strong understanding of recruitment techniques, sourcing strategies, and candidate assessment methods. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage and build relationships with candidates and internal stakeholders. High level of professionalism and integrity, with a commitment to maintaining confidentiality. Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other recruitment software/tools. Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and best practices. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to adapt to changing priorities and business needs. The Talent Acquisition Executive plays a crucial role in attracting and selecting top talent to drive the organization's success. This job description outlines the key responsibilities, qualifications, and skills required for the role.

column2: As an HR Recruiting Executive at SquadCX      com, you will play a crucial role in identifying and attracting top talent to support our growing BPS operations      Your responsibilities will include managing end-to-end recruitment processes, sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and collaborating with hiring managers to ensure the acquisition of skilled professionals who can contribute to our success                      Key Responsibilities:                1. **Talent Sourcing:** Use various sourcing methods, including job portals, social media, referrals, and networking, to identify and attract qualified candidates.              2. **Candidate Screening:** Review resumes and applications, conduct initial phone screens, and assess candidates qualifications, skills, and cultural fit.              3. **Interviewing:** Conduct in-depth interviews to evaluate candidates technical and soft skills, ensuring alignment with position requirements and company culture.              4. **Candidate Experience:** Provide a positive and professional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, ensuring clear communication and feedback.              5. **Collaboration:** Work closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies.              6. **Offer Management:** Negotiate and extend job offers to selected candidates, ensuring competitive compensation packages and timely offer acceptance.              7. **Onboarding Support:** Facilitate the onboarding process by coordinating with HR and other departments to ensure a smooth transition for new hires.              8. **Compliance:** Ensure compliance with all employment laws and regulations during the recruitment process.              9. **Reporting:** Maintain accurate records of recruitment activities and provide regular reports to management on recruitment metrics and progress.                Qualifications:                - Minimum of 2 years of experience in HR recruitment, specifically within the BPS industry.        - Proven track record of successfully recruiting for various roles within the BPS sector.        - Strong understanding of the BPS industry, including key roles, skills, and market trends.        - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.        - Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software.        - Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.        - Detail-oriented and organized with strong time management skills.        - Bachelors degree in HR, Business, or a related field preferred.                Why Join SquadCX.com:                - Competitive salary and benefits package.        - Opportunity to work with a dynamic and rapidly growing company in the outsourcing industry.        - Collaborative and inclusive work environment.        - Career development and growth opportunities.        - The chance to make a significant impact on our talent acquisition efforts.                    Qualifications:                  - Minimum of 2 years of experience in HR recruitment, specifically within the BPS industry.        - Proven track record of successfully recruiting for various roles within the BPS sector.        - Strong understanding of the BPS industry, including key roles, skills, and market trends.        - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.        - Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software.        - Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.        - Detail-oriented and organized with strong time management skills.        - Bachelors degree in HR, Business, or a related field preferred.

column2: Role & responsibilities  :   Greetings! About the companies: Nibav Home Elevators is the one-stop solution for having a lift for home in Chennai, as it is brilliantly crafted with advanced technology and years of innovations. Nibav is recognized as one of the most prestigious CE-certified vacuum home lift manufacturers in Chennai. Nibav stands out from the rest of the elevator companies in Chennai as highly efficient at providing small lifts for homes. Elite Elevators is one of the fastest-growing Home Elevators companies in India. We are business partners of ThyssenKrupp access Solution, and we deal with the premium segment of residential lifts. Our elevators are made in Italy and is installed in several states all over India is best known for its safety, quality, and technology. Designation: HR Executive Experience: 13 years Role Overview: As an HR executive at Nibav Lifts, you will play a crucial role in the recruitment process, focusing primarily on non-IT positions. You will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and selecting qualified candidates to meet the company's staffing needs. Additionally, you will be involved in various HR operational tasks to support the smooth functioning of the HR department. Responsibilities: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process for non-IT positions, including job posting, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selecting candidates. Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Build strong relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and external partners to ensure a positive recruitment experience. Conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting and selection tools/methods to filter candidates within the schedule. Assess applicants' relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience, and aptitudes. Onboard new employees in coordination with the HR team and department managers. Assist in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures. Handle employee relations issues and guide employees as needed. Maintain and update HR records and databases. Support the HR team in various operational tasks, including payroll, attendance management, and HR analytics. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field. Proven 1- 2 years of work experience as an HR recruiter, with a focus on non-IT recruitment. Familiarity with HR software and applicant tracking systems. Strong knowledge of recruitment techniques and best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Strong organizational and time-management skills. Attention to detail and accuracy. Others: 6 days of work ( Monday to Saturday) Chennai, Palavakkam KPI driven Onsite role

column2: Role & Responsibilities: We are looking for an Executive- Talent Acquisition t to join our Human Resources department and oversee our full-cycle recruiting. Talent Acquisition responsibilities include sourcing candidates through various channels, planning interview and selection procedures and hosting or participating in career events. To be successful in this role, you should be able to develop long-term recruiting strategies and nurture trusting relationships with potential hires. Ultimately, you will create strong talent pipelines for our companys current and future hiring needs. Responsibilities will include: Coordinate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs Determine selection criteria Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks) Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments and in-person interviews Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using our Applicant Tracking System Design job descriptions and interview questions that reflect each position?? requirements Lead employer branding initiatives Organize and attend job fairs and recruitment events Forecast quarterly and annual hiring needs by department Foster long-term relationships with past applicants and potential candidates Who are we looking for? We are looking for someone who can grow with us and make Zouk one of the biggest global brands from India. An ideal candidate would be someone with the following: Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist or similar role Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience in Lifestyle, Fashion and Retail Industry is a must A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations Why join us? We are a young and dynamic team, so you will get to make a signicant impact, learn a lot, and have fun in the process. We are building our team as well, so this is a great opportunity to quickly climb up the ladder and become among the top D2C experts in India. We are a well-funded business, with best-in-class D2C founders as our investors. We are rapidly growing month-on-month, so you get to be a part of the hyper-growth phase.

column2: Latteys Inds is looking for HR Executive to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Full-Cycle Recruitment: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process for various positions, including sourcing candidates, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making hiring recommendations.     Sourcing and Networking: Utilize various sourcing methods, including online job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals, to attract qualified candidates. Build and maintain a network of potential candidates for current and future hiring needs.     Candidate Assessment: Conduct thorough interviews to assess candidates' skills, qualifications, and fit for specific roles. Evaluate candidates' technical skills, experience, cultural fit, and career aspirations.     Candidate Experience: Provide a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Communicate effectively with candidates, provide timely updates, and ensure a smooth and professional interview process.     Hiring Manager Collaboration: Partner closely with hiring managers to understand staffing needs, develop job descriptions, and create recruitment strategies. Provide guidance and support to hiring managers on recruitment best practices and market trends.     Talent Pipeline Management: Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for key roles. Proactively identify and engage passive candidates for future opportunities.     Recruitment Metrics: Track and report recruitment metrics, including time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and candidate satisfaction. Use data and analytics to evaluate recruitment effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.     Employer Branding: Represent the organization positively to candidates and external stakeholders. Promote the company's values, culture, and employer brand to attract top talent.     Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies throughout the recruitment process. Maintain accurate and up-to-date recruitment records and documentation.

column2: The role will be working in one of our innovative ventures     and will be instrumental in         leading the attraction, selection and placement process within VBS and on a project basis across the Blenheim Chalcot portfolio. This will include a range of roles in different sectors at varying levels of seniority.                 The role is designed to be an integral part of Blenheim Chalcot s central function with progression opportunities within the team and/or our portfolio companies.           Key responsibilities           Help run the recruitment function of Blenheim Chalcot, managing the end to end recruitment processes across the portfolio.       Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and hiring managers, ensuring best-in-class recruitment processes are adhered to.     Produce regular reports on progress and placements for the management team.     Lead on all end-to-end recruitment processes, including conducting interviews, liaising with key stakeholders, and updating people systems.      Demonstrate a growth mindset to continuously improve the processes and activities.            Specific duties       It is essential that you re confident and comfortable with doing the following:        be able to transition between different projects with the ability to deliver results quickly,      continuously develop innovative methods to attract top talent,     be on point for all elements of the hiring process,      work in a highly entrepreneurial environment, focusing on execution and ensuring plans come to fruition; and, consistently build strong relationships quickly with stakeholders in the business and Blenheim Chalcot team.           ABOUT YOU       The ideal candidate will have a track-record in delivering results ideally in a fast-moving business and hence be comfortable with change and uncertainty. You must have a can-do attitude, ability to manage multiple tasks and superb interpersonal skills.          The Ideal Candidate         An ambitious and driven individual 2 + years work experience in a recruitment role.     A bachelor s degree.     Experience using recruitment systems such as LinkedIn Recruiter and Greenhouse (or equivalent) is preferred.     Youre a problem solver - you take ownership and won t settle until the problem is resolved.      You re resilient and love to use any learnings to improve a process next time round.      You thrive from working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable with ambiguity.      You re willing to get stuck in - we re a small team so you ll be happy get involved in projects outside of your job description.      You re collaborative by nature, looking to work with & elevate those around you.     Excellent relationship building and stakeholder management skills.

Landmark: Adjacent to MD Everywhere and in Algoworks Building              Job Description:     Searching Candidates as per the requirement of Company. Arranging & conducting Interviews/Initial screening of the candidates/ helping in recruitment processes.    Communicating with all candidates on a regular basis. Company Profile:         Kindly visit our website : www.almamate.in    AlmaMate has been founded by professionals with vast IT industry experience. AlmaMate is a young, dynamic and fast growing organization. It has been selected as NASSCOM Emerge 50 company for the year 2011. Its mission is to transform people and businesses by creating innovative products and solutions. AlmaMate is building exciting cloud based products by using state-of-art technologies. AlmaMate has very ambitious plans to become a market leader by building products based on cloud technology.    AlmaMate is into 3 verticals:        Product development    Corporate training    RPO             Perks and Benefits? open to discuss

column2: About the Job Role:       Talent Acquisition is a part of Globals core People Management function. In this role, the candidate sources, screens and provides shortlists of qualified applicants for various IT-related roles. In addition to that, a Technical Recruiter / Talent Acquisition personnel promotes Globals brand by networking with potential candidates using online/offline channels, ensures that it attracts talented professionals and reduces its time-to-hire. The ultimate goal is helping a company build strong talent pipeline satisfying current as well as future hiring needs of IT professionals. So, if you like to work in a fast-paced environment and qualify our requirements, we would like to hear from you.         Responsibilities:         Writing and posting technical job advertisements and descriptions.         Parsing specialized qualifications and skills for screening IT resumes.         Sourcing potential candidates via professional platforms, (e.g. Github, Stack Overflow).         Conducting task and job analyses for documenting job duties as well as requirements.         Should have sourced candidates in technologies such as Java, Python, MySQL, Mongo DB, Android, iOS, React Native, Node.js, etc.         Staying aware of new technological products as well as the latest trends.         Onboarding new hires.         Promoting the reputation of our company as a nice workplace.         Participating in tech meetups and conferences for networking with talented IT professionals.         Composing job offer and recruitment letters.         Coordinating with team leaders for forecasting the hiring needs and setting the department goals.         Crafting and sending recruiting emails to passive candidates with current open jobs.         Performing pre-screening interviews for analysing the abilities of candidates.         Interviewing candidates using various techniques (e.g. technical assessments, behavioural and structured questions).           Requirements:         Bachelor s degree in IT and MBA in HR or a relevant field Master s degree.         Prior experience as a Technical Recruiter / IT Recruiter for at least 3 years.         Solid technical background needed to understand as well as explain requirements for IT-related jobs.         Prior experience with conducting various types of interviews (e.g. structured, phone, Zoom Calls).         Experience with resume databases and Applicant Tracking Systems.         Experience with various sourcing methods (e.g. Boolean search, social media recruiting using LinkedIn and other platforms etc.).         Experience in Head Hunting and sound knowledge of full cycle recruiting.         Sound knowledge of all labour regulations and HR practices.         Strong verbal as well as non-verbal communication skills.         Exceptional time-management and organizational skills.
column11: Screening, Communication Skills, Social Media, Sourcing, Hr, It Recruiter, Technical Recruiter, Interviewing, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition

column2: Recruitment Strategy: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for various positions within the organization. Partner with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop job descriptions and selection criteria.        Sourcing: Utilize various channels including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals to source high-quality candidates.          Candidate Screening: Conduct initial screening interviews to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and cultural fit.          Interview Coordination:Manage the interview process, including scheduling interviews, collecting feedback from interviewers, and facilitating hiring decisions.          Candidate Experience: Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process by providing timely communication and feedback.          Employer Branding: Promote the companys employer brand to attract top talent and maintain a positive reputation in the market. Build and maintain relationships with candidates to create a talent pipeline for future hiring needs.          Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS).          Collaboration: Work closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their hiring needs and priorities.          Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in talent acquisition to continuously improve recruitment processes.         Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.          2-4 years of experience in talent acquisition or recruitment, preferably in a fast-paced environment.          Familiarity with recruitment tools and techniques, including applicant tracking systems and social media platforms.          Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates and stakeholders at all levels.          Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.          Results-driven mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality candidates in a timely manner.          Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team.

column2: The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience as a Bench Sales Recruiter in the IT industry, with a proven track record of success.        Responsibilities:          Source and screen potential candidates for contract, contract-to-hire, and full-time positions.      Build and maintain relationships with candidates, vendors, and clients to generate business opportunities and maintain a steady pipeline of potential candidates.      Use various job portals, social media platforms, and other channels to source candidates with the necessary skills and experience.      Manage the entire recruitment process from initial sourcing to final placement, including conducting initial screenings and interviews, coordinating client interviews, and negotiating rates and terms.      Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate data in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools.      Work closely with Account Managers and Sales teams to understand client requirements and provide appropriate candidates for open positions.      Conduct reference checks and background checks to ensure candidate credibility and suitability.      Collaborate with technical recruiters and sales teams to ensure that candidate qualifications and skills align with client needs.      Manage vendor relationships, including negotiating terms and resolving any issues that arise.      Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure repeat business.      Keep abreast of industry trends, including changes to immigration and employment regulations, and incorporate relevant information into the recruitment process.      Attend industry events and conferences to build networks and identify potential business opportunities.      Maintain a thorough understanding of each client's business and industry to ensure that candidates are a good fit.      Provide regular updates to clients on candidate status, interview feedback, and other relevant information.      Participate in the creation and delivery of presentations, proposals, and other sales materials to clients.      Prepare and submit weekly and monthly reports on candidate pipeline, sales activity, and revenue generated.      Follow up with clients and candidates post-placement to ensure satisfaction and identify areas for improvement.      Work closely with HR teams to ensure compliance with all employment laws and regulations.      Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment processes and make recommendations for improvements.      Perform other duties as assigned by management to meet business objectives and goals.                Requirements          Requires a Bachelor's degree Business Administration, Human Resources, or related field.      Must have 2+ years of experience as a Bench Sales Recruiter in the IT industry, with a proven track record of success.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential, as communication is critical to this role.      Knowledge of different visa types such as H1B, EAD, Green Card etc. is required to source the right candidates.      Familiarity with various job portals such as Dice, Monster, CareerBuilder, Indeed, etc. is essential for effective candidate sourcing.      Must have a solid understanding of the Bench Sales process, including sourcing, screening, and placement to match candidates with client requirements.      Experience managing relationships with vendors and clients is required to generate business opportunities and maintain client satisfaction.      Ability to negotiate rates and contractual terms with candidates and clients is essential to ensure successful placements and profitable deals.      Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools is required to efficiently manage candidate data and streamline the recruitment process.      Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is necessary for creating and managing reports, presentations, and documents.      Experience conducting initial screenings and interviews to determine candidate suitability is required to ensure only the best candidates are presented to clients.      Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets is essential, as this role is sales-driven and requires achieving revenue goals.      Ability to work independently with minimal supervision is necessary to manage a large volume of work and meet deadlines.      Ability to multitask and prioritize workload effectively is required to manage multiple clients and candidates simultaneously.      Strong organizational and time management skills are essential to manage a high volume of data and candidates efficiently.      Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills is necessary to identify and resolve issues during the recruitment process.      Flexibility to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment is required to adapt to changing client and candidate needs.      Demonstrated ability to maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate and client interactions is necessary for effective data management and reporting.      Ability to work in a team-oriented environment and collaborate effectively with team members is required to achieve collective goals.      Must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client needs and time zones as this role may involve working with clients across different geographies.

column2: Job Title:   HR Recruiter Job Summary:  The HR Recruiter plays a pivotal role in the recruitment process by providing administrative support to the Talent Acquisition team. This individual assists in the coordination of various recruitment activities, from sourcing candidates to onboarding new hires. The ideal candidate possesses excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Skills/Requirements/Roles & Responsibilities Candidate Sourcing:  Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, and networking, to attract potential candidates. Resume Screening:  Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates for open positions. Scheduling Interviews:  Coordinate interview schedules between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient process. Interview Support:  Assist in the coordination of interview logistics, such as booking meeting rooms, preparing interview materials, and communicating with candidates. Candidate Communication:  Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates and feedback as needed. Reference Checks:  Conduct reference checks for selected candidates, verifying employment history and qualifications. Offer Processing:  Assist in the preparation and processing of employment offers, including generating offer letters and coordinating with the relevant stakeholders. Onboarding Support:  Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including paperwork completion, orientation scheduling, and assisting with any logistical needs. Data Management:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS) or other recruitment software. Preferred candidate profile   : Fresher's Only Proficient in MS Office Detail-oriented interviewer Great decision-making skills Fluent in English Salary : up to 3 LPA + Incentives Work Location : YourPitchh, Jayanagar 9th block, Bangalore - 560069 To schedule the interview contact, +91-8088671484                                                                 +91-7892715993

column2: Job Title: HR Recruiter (BPO Hiring)   Location:  3rd Floor, Mallik's Embassy, 9, Union St, off Infantry Road, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001      Please call us on - 9972827624 Email - guru@thejobfactory.co.in   Company Overview:   The Job Factory  is a leading provider of Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) solutions, specializing in all hiring sectors. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional talent service, innovative solutions, and operational excellence to our clients Pan India. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a dynamic and a suitable HR Recruiter to join our team and drive our talent acquisition efforts within the BPO domain.   Job Overview: As an HR Recruiter specializing in hiring, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and recruiting top talent to meet the staffing needs of our clients. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand workforce requirements, develop recruitment strategies, and ensure a seamless recruitment process from sourcing to onboarding.   Key Responsibilities: Partner with hiring managers at our site to understand staffing needs and involve in comprehensive recruitment plans set by our team. Utilize various sourcing channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals, to attract a diverse pool of candidates for BPO positions. Screen resumes, conduct pre-screening interviews, and evaluate candidates qualifications, skills, and cultural fit for BPO roles. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and stakeholders, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Conduct behavioral interviews and assess candidates competencies, motivations, and alignment with our organizational values and culture. Collaborate with HR colleagues to ensure seamless onboarding and orientation for new hires, including compliance with company policies and procedures. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in BPO recruitment to enhance our talent acquisition strategies.   Qualifications:  Any graduates/ Undergraduate who have will to pursue your career into recruitment are welcome to apply Salary : Negotiable      Join Our Team: If you are passionate about talent acquisition and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, we invite you to join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our organization. Apply now to be part of our journey! Please call us on - 9972827624 Email - guru@thejobfactory.co.in

column2: HI,   We are looking for an Sr. HR Recruiter , (Candidate Must Be From Lucknow)  to manage our full cycle recruitment, from identifying potential hires to interviewing and evaluating candidates. HR Recruiter responsibilities include sourcing candidates online, updating job ads and conducting background checks. If you have experience with various job interview formats, including phone screenings and group interviews, and can help us recruit faster and more effectively, wed like to meet you. Ultimately, you will play an important part in building a strong employer brand for our company to ensure we attract, hire and retain the most qualified employees. Job Brief : 1) Work Timing : 9.30 am to 6.00 pm  (Monday to Fri), Every Saturday Halfday and Sunday off 2) Candidate Needs to Have Excellent Communication Skills 3) Candidate Must Be Ready To Work With Extreme Dedication 4) HR Recruiter needs to Source the candidates as per directions of Clients 5) Candidate Must Have a Laptop, Net Connection and Smart Phone Contact : Ananya  @  7388728859   Responsibilities Design and update job descriptions Source potential candidates from various online channels (e.g. social media and professional platforms like Naukri) Craft recruiting emails to attract passive candidates Screen incoming resumes and application forms Interview candidates (via phone, video) Provide shortlists of qualified candidates to hiring managers Send job offer emails and answer queries about compensation and benefits Monitor key HR metrics, including time-to-fill, time-to-hire and source of hire Collaborate with managers to identify future hiring needs Act as a consultant to new hires and help them onboard

column2: Role & responsibilities   Looking for a Recruitment who can work on Engineering / Manufacturing / Support function requirements for Automotive & Manufacturing industries. This position operates from an office location. Engineer from any background like Manufacturing, Sales, Customer care, Service experience, but wanting to get into Recruitment would also be preferred.  Preferred candidate profile     1. Source profiles from various source like Naukri, LinkedIn, References, Internal Database. 2. Interact with candidate, doing initial screening. Understand their competencies & skill sets, making them understand the job role. 3. Analyze Job Profile and Client Company's Profile. 4. Initiate Job Posting and Bulk Mailing 5. Provide complete, accurate, and inspiring information to candidates about the company and position. 6. Prepare candidates for interviewing with the clients by providing detailed information about job descriptions, and expectation. 7. Interact with clients/Manager and understand the requirements. 8. Schedule & Coordinate the interview between Candidate and Client. 9. Take feedback after interview. Repeat the process until the Position/Mandates/ Requirements is closed. 10. Looking candidates through Mapping, Head Hunting for Senior Requirements 11. Coordinate with the candidate until Joining and Receiving Payment 12. Maintaining daily/weekly/monthly reports such as Position Status, interview status reports, closure reports & feedback reports. 13. Sound communication skills to deal with the candidates & Good at client interaction. Proficient in recruiting candidates from all levels Junior Level to Senior Level    Role: Non IT Recruiter Industry Type: Automobile Department: Human Resources Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent Role Category: Recruitment & Talent Acquisition Education B.Tech /B.E. and MBA

column2: Technical Recruiter -  Day Shifts   Vadodara,  IN   Full- Time   Human Resources   ??echnical Recruiter -  Day ShiftsAbout the Recruiter position   We are looking for a Recruiter with full- cycle recruiting experience,  from talent sourcing and attracting candidates to interviewing and hiring great employees.   A successful recruiter will collaborate with company clients on a regular basis and proactively identify future hiring needs. You should also be able to attract candidates using various sources,  like social media networks and employee referrals. Our ideal recruiter holds an academic HR background combined with work experience in screening,  interviewing and assessing candidates.   Ultimately,  the responsibilities of the Recruiter are to ensure our company attracts,  hires and retains the best employees,  while growing a strong talent pipeline.   Recruiter Position responsibilities are:   Source candidates using Internet- based sourcing techniques: job boards,  web crawlers,  search engines,  social networking tools,  university alumni sites,  blogs,  local organizations websites,  discussion groups,  and public and proprietary resume databases.   Full lifecycle recruiting experience -  understanding the job order,  sourcing and qualifying the right candidates,  handling negotiations,  and closing deals.   Work directly with client account managers and hiring managers in determining hiring needs,  interviewing process and offer negotiations.   Conduct professional assessment and verification for skills,  experience,  availability,  compensation,  willingness to travel/ relocate and overall suitability for the position.   Prepare submission documents for each shortlisted candidate and schedule interviews.   Communicate with candidates throughout the hiring process.   Creating and Maintaining strong Database of candidates across all verticals and domains.   Maintain daily and weekly client reports.   Interact with candidates on billing to check project status and reusability.   Recruiter requirements are:   Experience as a Recruiter in India market   Excellent analytical skills   Familiar with HR databases like Naukri,  Monster,  Shine,  LinkedIn,  Etc   Familiar with MS Office softwares   Great problem- solving skills   Effective communication skills

column2: A Special Education Need (SEN) teacher is required in our Preschool an immediate start. This exciting SEN teacher opportunity is available on an ongoing and full time basis. This particular role is likely to be working with a pupil SEN primarily, although there may also be opportunity to support other students in addition to this pupil.     An experienced SEN teacher is required for a 1:1 tuition style role. The role would involve supporting primary aged students who have a broad range of SEN. All experience is welcome as having the right attitude is the most important asset. The appointed candidate must be confident when it comes to working with children with behavioral issues, have a calm demeanor, be a team player and have a firm understanding of the primary education system.     This post involves working with children with various SEN on a 1:1 basis, however, many children may have SEN and may have ESBD, so experience in this field would be desirable. A patient and committed individual who likes a challenge and is looking for a rewarding role would be ideal for this position.     The successful SEN teacher must:     Have experience of working with pupils with SEN and feel confident working with pupils who have challenging behavior     Be comfortable supporting pupils on a 1:1 basis     Be comfortable supporting pupils with Special Needs (Emotional, Behavioral and/or Learning needs)     Certificate in Special education     Be able to start immediately and commit to this role     In return, we can offer competitive salary and good working environment.

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION - TAGGD   About   Taggd:  Taggd is a digital recruitment platform that provides Ready-to-Hire talent to India Inc. Combining the power of human knowledge and data, Taggd has successfully fulfilled talent mandates of more than 100+ clients and ensured hiring managers success for half a million jobs from over 14+ sectors. With a vision to fulfil 1 million Jobs through our talent platform by 2025, we strive to connect people with people, people with companies, and people with opportunities. Just right. Every time. For more information pls visit  www.taggd.in About   the   Position: Role:   Senior   Recruitment Associate Associate Reporting   to:  Manager RPO  Location:   Bangalore   Working: 5 days (Monday-FrIday) Work from Office About   the   Role:  At Taggd, our people are our most important resource. Were looking for a highly skilled recruiter to become one of them, and to help us find them. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in recruitment or talent acquisition, with knowledge of screening, interviewing, and hiring practices. If you have a passion for finding untapped talent, driving company growth, and helping individuals find promising careers, we want to hear from you. Job Posting:  Create and post job advertisements on job boards, company website, and other relevant platforms. Candidate Experience:  Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process by providing timely communication, feedback, and guidance. Offer Negotiation:  Assist in extending job offers, negotiating compensation packages, and ensuring a smooth transition for new hires. Data Management:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records and recruitment metrics to track progress and effectiveness. column1: Recruitment Training Specialist (Advanced Sourcing & Job Boards)
column2: Summary: Are you passionate about recruitment and excited to share your expertise with others? We're seeking a Recruitment Training Specialist to join our team and develop training programs focused on advanced sourcing techniques and job board utilization.  In this role, you'll leverage your in-depth knowledge of LinkedIn X-Ray search, strategic job board searching, and best practices to empower our recruiters to become talent acquisition superstars. Responsibilities: Develop and deliver engaging training programs: * Design and implement comprehensive training programs on advanced sourcing methodologies, including utilizing LinkedIn X-Ray search and Boolean operators for targeted searches. Become a job board guru: *  Craft training modules that equip recruiters with the skills to leverage various job boards effectively, tailoring search strategies and job postings to maximize reach and attract top talent. Stay on top of trends: * Continuously research and integrate the latest sourcing tools and best practices into your training programs. Facilitate interactive workshops: *  Lead interactive workshops to equip recruiters with practical skills for building strong candidate pipelines and attracting passive candidates. Evaluate training effectiveness: * Measure the impact of your training programs through assessments and feedback mechanisms, ensuring continuous improvement. Qualifications: * Minimum 3-5 years of experience in recruitment with a proven track record of success. * Extensive experience utilizing advanced sourcing techniques, including LinkedIn X-Ray search, Boolean operators, and other search filters. * In-depth knowledge of various job board ecosystems and the ability to identify the most relevant platforms for diverse roles. * Demonstrated ability to design and deliver engaging training programs for adult learners. * Strong communication, presentation, and facilitation skills. * Experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS) a plus. * Passion for knowledge sharing and fostering a learning culture within the team. Bonus Points: * Experience developing and delivering online training modules. * Experience working within a specific industry (relevant to your company). * Data analysis skills to track and measure sourcing and recruitment metrics. * Proficiency in creating training materials, presentations, and simulations. We Offer: * Competitive salary and benefits package. * Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. * Play a key role in developing our recruitment team's capabilities. * Be part of a growing and successful team. More details contact : Swathi @ 6364880244 /  Harshita @ 7075992967

column2: Company Overview: Opulent Investment Adviser Private Limited is a leading organization in the [BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance)] sector, committed to helping equity investors to grow their wealth with the right investment advice. Our mission is to help investors to fulfill their financial dreams. We are dedicated to attracting top talent to drive our mission forward and ensure our continued success. Position Overview: We are seeking a motivated and experienced Recruiter / Recruitment Specialist to join our dynamic HR team. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of recruitment experience, preferably within the BFSI sector, and a proven track record of sourcing, screening, and hiring top-tier talent. This is a hybrid role, offering flexibility to work in our Mumbai office as well as remotely. Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs. Source candidates through various channels, including job portals, social media, professional networks, and referrals. Conduct screening interviews to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and facilitate the selection process. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system. Build and maintain relationships with candidates to ensure a positive experience throughout the recruitment process. Assist in the negotiation and preparation of employment offers. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 2-3 years of experience in recruitment, preferably within the BFSI sector. Strong communication and interviewing skills. Proven ability to source and attract top talent through various channels. Proficiency in using job portals and other social platforms. Why Join Us: Opportunity to work with a leading organization in the BFSI sector and contribute to its success. Collaborative and supportive work environment that values innovation and diversity. Competitive compensation and benefits package. What We Offer: We believe in nurturing our employees' well-being and work-life balance. That's why we provide: Statutory Benefits:  Enjoy Provident Fund, Employees State Insurance Scheme, and Maternity Leave. Paid Time Off:  Recharge and rejuvenate with 12 holidays, 18 earned leaves, 6 casual leaves, and even a special birthday leave. Pleasant Workspace:  Experience the open cafeteria and a participatory environment, creating an atmosphere that fosters creativity and collaboration. If you are passionate about recruitment and eager to make an impact in the BFSI sector, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications. We look forward to hearing from you! How to Join Us: If you are ready to revolutionize the financial sector, come grow with us! Send your resume to hr@stockaxis.com, and don't forget to mention your qualifications and why you believe you're the perfect candidate for this position.

column2: Research Associate:A Research Associate is an academic or professional who works closely with faculty members, researchers, or principal investigators on research projects      This role is common in universities, research institutions, and corporate research divisions        Responsibilities may include:        Conducting literature reviews and background research on specific topics      Designing experiments, simulations, or data collection methods      Analyzing data and drawing conclusions from research findings      Collaborating with other researchers, including faculty members and graduate students      Writing research papers, reports, and contributing to academic publications      Presenting research findings at conferences and seminars      A Research Associate typically holds at least a master's degree, and often a PhD, in a relevant field and contributes to advancing the knowledge and understanding of their subject area      Mathematics Consultant:A Mathematics Consultant is a professional who provides expertise and guidance on mathematical concepts, problems, or applications to individuals, organizations, or businesses      This role may involve working in various industries, including education, finance, engineering, and technology        Responsibilities may include:        Providing solutions to mathematical problems or challenges faced by clients      Advising on mathematical modeling and analysis for specific projects or processes      Offering guidance on implementing mathematical algorithms or techniques      Designing and delivering training sessions or workshops on mathematical concepts      Collaborating with teams to optimize processes using mathematical approaches      Assisting educators in developing math curriculum or instructional materials

Improve workforce performance and productivity, boosts business agility, increases revenue and reduces costsEmployee Services - More into query/case managementEmployment and Labor Law encompasses the relationships among unions, employers, and employees. Labor laws grant employees in certain sectors the right to unionize and allow employers and employees to engage in certain workplace-related activities in order to further their demands for changes in the employer-employee relationship. column2: As a Recruitment Intern, you will play a vital role in supporting our HR and recruitment team in identifying and attracting top talent to our organization. This internship will provide you with hands-on experience in the field of recruitment, offering exposure to various aspects of the hiring process.      *Key Responsibilities:*      1. *Candidate Sourcing:* Assist in sourcing candidates through various channels, such as job boards, social media, and professional networks.      2. *Resume Screening:* Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates, ensuring they meet the required qualifications and skills.      3. *Interview Coordination:* Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth interview process.      4. *Candidate Communication:* Communicate with candidates via email or phone, providing information about the interview process, status updates, and feedback.      5. *Application Tracking:* Maintain and update applicant tracking systems (ATS) to ensure accurate and organized candidate records.      6. *Reference Checks:* Assist in conducting reference checks for potential hires.      7. *Job Posting:* Create and post job listings on various job boards and our company website.      8. *Data Analysis:* Compile recruitment metrics and reports, helping to identify areas for improvement in the recruitment process.      9. *Employer Branding:* Contribute to employer branding initiatives, such as creating content for social media and career pages to attract potential candidates.      *Qualifications:*      - Currently enrolled in a relevant degree program (Human Resources, Business Administration, etc.) or recent graduate.      - Strong communication and interpersonal skills.      - Detail-oriented and organized with excellent time management skills.      - Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.      - Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).      - Enthusiasm for learning and a strong interest in recruitment and HR.      *Benefits:*      - Practical experience in the recruitment and human resources field.      - Exposure to various aspects of the hiring process.      - Mentorship and guidance from experienced HR professionals.      - Networking opportunities within the HR and recruitment industry.      - Potential for future employment opportunities based on performance.

column2: Job Summary: As a Field Recruiter, you will play a crucial role in sourcing, attracting and selecting talent for our organization. Your responsibilities will include Field Recruitment, Placements and other Mobilisation activities. This role requires you to be proactive, organized, and an effective communicator, as you will be interacting with candidates and collaborating with various departments within the company. Responsibilities: Candidate Sourcing and Outreach: Identify potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, social media, networking events and referrals. Reach out to potential candidates through phone calls, emails and in-person meetings to gauge their interest and qualifications. Candidate Screening: Review resumes and applications to assess qualifications and suitability for open positions. Conduct initial phone screenings to evaluate candidates skills, experience, and cultural fit. Interviewing and Assessment: Coordinate and conduct in-person or virtual interviews with candidates. Assess candidates technical skills, soft skills, and alignment with company values. Administer assessment tests or assignments as needed. Collaboration with Hiring Managers: Partner with hiring managers of organisations, industries, NGOs, etc. to understand their staffing needs and requirements. Provide guidance and recommendations to hiring managers throughout the recruitment process. Candidate Documentation and Tracking: Maintain accurate and organized records of candidate information, interview feedback, and communication history. Use applicant tracking systems (ATS) or other tools to manage the recruitment pipeline. Job Offer Negotiation: Assist in extending job offers to selected candidates. Collaborate with the HR team to ensure smooth on-boarding processes. Networking and Relationship Building: Cultivate and maintain relationships with potential candidates and industry contacts. Attend job fairs, industry conferences, and other events to expand the talent pool.

column2: We are EA       We entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That?s why we employ the most creative , passionate people in the industry.       The Challenge Ahead:     We have an exciting opportunity for a Talent Coordinator to join our growing team in Guildford.?   The successful candidate will have experience as a Coordinator in a high volume , fast- paced environment.   ?This role would be a fantastic opportunity for somebody to join a hard- working , fun , and passionate Recruitment team within an internationally recognised brand.     You will play an important role in ensuring that all candidates who interact with Electronic Arts have an exceptional and memorable experience , creating a seamless and efficient recruiting process. In partnership with the team , you will schedule candidate interviews with EA?s various business groups , be a champion for candidate experience and guide applicants on their journey to becoming EA employees. This role requires a superior level of professional interaction with candidates , business stakeholders and many other teams that work together to attract and onboard our future employees.           What a Talent Coordinator does at EA:         Mentored by our Talent Specialist you will support the recruitment team across a variety of administrative and operational processes       Coordinating , scheduling and tracking all phases of the interview process           Track and update candidate interactions in our ATS and other tools       Sending and retrieving of important documentation , such as Non- Disclosure Agreements , Feedback Forms       Books candidate travel and processes candidate travel expenses     Collaborates with other team members to improve and streamline processes     Reviews and audits offer details and employment contracts           Ensures thorough coordination and execution of new hire onboarding tasks (processing transactions , coordination with internal teams , new hire packages)           Participates in New Hire Orientation (Point of contact for new employees , facilitating studio tours and inductions)         Works closely with other areas of our People Experience team , including HR Business Partners , Global Mobility , Compensation and Benefits and Workday to ensure that candidates have a smooth onboarding process     Actively participates in team projects , which strengthen the service we provide     Maintains a high level of confidentiality and professionalism at all times     Additional Ad- Hoc duties as needed by the Talent Acquisition team         The next Talent Coordinator needs:         Experience working in an administrative capacity , for a fast- paced organisation     Exceptional organisational skills , ensuring interviews are correctly scheduled , confirmed and tracked     To be passionate about delivering a first- class , consistent service to candidates , recruiters and hiring managers     Strong verbal and written communication skills , exceptional organisational skills , and the ability to prioritise competing tasks in a fast- paced environment     To be comfortable working to tight deadlines with strong time- management skills and exceptional attention to detail     You should have a collaborative approach , with strong interpersonal skills and thrive in a diverse team environment     The ability to communicate with people across all levels         We appreciate the work contractors provide , so here at EA we like to offer you great facilities while you are working onsite including:         Free onsite gym     Two annual parties (Summer Christmas)     Brand new onsite cafe     Our very own barista     Games Area

column2: Company Name: - Alexander man solutions (AMS)  Client- Confidential (Global Pharmaceutical MNC ) Job Title:  Recruiter specialist Job Location: Mumbai     Work Model- Onsite   Job Summary:   As a Recruiter Specialist for the RPO (Recruitment Process Outsourcing) team, you will be responsible for managing end-to-end recruitment activities for our pharmaceutical client. You will work closely with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand their staffing needs and identify qualified candidates through various sourcing methods. You will be responsible for screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates, as well as managing the entire recruitment process from sourcing to onboarding. Your expertise in the health care, Pharma industry and knowledge of talent acquisition best practices will be crucial in identifying top talent for our client's organization.   Key Responsibilities:      Collaborate with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand their recruitment needs and develop a comprehensive recruitment strategy for in Pharma commercial roles (Sales & Marketing, Business development, Analytics) Corporate, Legal & Marketing within the APAC region.   Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals, to identify and attract qualified candidates. ? Conduct thorough screening, interviewing, and assessment of candidates to evaluate their skills, experience, and cultural fit with the organization. ? Manage the entire recruitment process, including scheduling interviews, conducting background checks, negotiating job offers, and facilitating onboarding for selected candidates. ? Build and maintain a talent pipeline for PHLD roles, ensuring a steady pool of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs. ? Stay updated with industry trends, market insights, and competitive intelligence related to Pharma talent acquisition, and provide recommendations to optimize recruitment strategies. ? Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate data in the applicant tracking system (ATS) and other recruitment tools to ensure data integrity and compliance with data protection regulations. ? column2: Job Title: US Pharma Recruiter Location: Bangalore & Hyderabad Job Type: Full-Time Job Summary: The Pharma Recruiter is responsible for managing the full recruitment cycle for positions within the pharmaceutical industry. This includes developing and implementing effective recruitment strategies, sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and collaborating with hiring managers to ensure the best talent is brought into the organization. The recruiter will also be responsible for maintaining a talent pipeline and staying informed about industry trends and regulations. Key Responsibilities: Talent Acquisition:  Source, screen, and present qualified candidates for various roles within the pharmaceutical industry, including R&D, regulatory affairs, clinical trials, quality assurance, and sales/marketing positions. Recruitment Strategy:  Develop and execute innovative recruiting strategies to attract top-tier talent, including utilizing social media, job boards, industry-specific forums, networking events, and employee referrals. Candidate Screening:  Conduct initial phone screens and in-depth interviews to assess candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit. Stakeholder Collaboration:  Work closely with hiring managers to understand job requirements, provide regular updates, and make recommendations on candidate selections. Pipeline Management:  Build and maintain a network of potential candidates through proactive market research and ongoing relationship management. Compliance:  Ensure all recruiting practices comply with relevant employment laws and regulations, including EEO, ADA, and affirmative action guidelines. Reporting:  Maintain accurate records of all recruiting activities and provide regular reports on recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, source of hire, and diversity statistics. Employer Branding:  Promote the company as an employer of choice by representing the company at industry events, job fairs, and online platforms. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Life Sciences, or a related field. Experience:  Minimum of 3-5 years of recruiting experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. Skills: Strong understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and related roles. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other recruitment software. Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical skills to assess recruiting metrics and improve processes.
column11: US Pharma recruiter, Life Sciences, Pharmaceutics, Clinical, Medical Devices, Pharmacovigilance, Pharmaceutical, US Recruitment

column2: This role involves daily stand-up meetings to discuss priorities, reviewing tickets from the previous day, conducting building walkthroughs with the CM team to inspect infrastructure and create tickets for any issues found.     Key duties are managing tickets by reviewing new submissions, assigning or escalating them appropriately, and ensuring they have all necessary information for resolution. Effective communication with stakeholders is crucial to gather additional information and provide status updates, ensuring transparency and a high member experience.      Monitoring SLA compliance, following up on escalated tickets, and sending professional responses to resolved tickets are essential tasks. Additionally, the role involves organizing ticket data for monthly reports, participating in discussions to improve processes and service quality, and reviewing tickets before 6 pm to update the team on high-priority issues needing attention post 6 pm or during weekends.         Roles and Responsibilities :           Ticket Management: Assist in handling and responding to tickets, ensuring high-quality and timely responses.         Exceptional Member Experience: Focus on delivering outstanding service and experiences to members.         Written Communication: Utilize excellent written English skills to communicate effectively and professionally through support requests.         Hospitality Knowledge: Apply hospitality principles to enhance member satisfaction and service quality.         Backend Support: Perform backend tasks to ensure a seamless ticket resolution experience.         Report Generation: Assist team members in generating and compiling monthly reports.         Collaboration: Work closely with other teams to resolve queries and close tickets efficiently.         Technologically inclined: Can work well with technology and systems.           Experience and Requirements :           Strong proficiency in written English         Inclined towards working with Technology         Needs to have a member focussed outlook         Ability to deliver exceptional member experience         Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills         Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment         Familiarity with WeWork s competencies and service standards         Role is physical on site         Requires moving between different locations when needed         Contract with possibility of extension

column2: We are looking for a skilled and proactive HR Recruiting Manager to join our HR team and support our talent acquisition efforts in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry. The FMCG Recruiter will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and attracting top talent to meet our staffing needs and support business growth Key Responsibilities: Develop innovative sourcing strategies to attract top talent through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals. Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs. Develop and execute candidate engagement strategies to ensure a positive and seamless recruitment experience. Maintain ongoing communication with candidates, provide timely feedback, and manage candidate expectations. Oversee the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, candidate screening, interviewing, assessment, offer negotiation, and onboarding. Ensure compliance with company policies, legal requirements, and best practices. Analyze recruitment metrics, trends, and performance indicators to track hiring effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions. Prepare regular reports and insights for senior management. Collaborate with hiring managers, department heads, and cross-functional teams to understand staffing needs, define job requirements, and ensure alignment on recruitment priorities. Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Conduct screening interviews, assess candidate qualifications, and coordinate interview processes with hiring teams. Lead and mentor a team of recruiters, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure high-performance and achievement of recruitment goals. Manage the offer and negotiation process, ensuring a positive candidate experience and timely onboarding of new hires. Track recruitment metrics, analyze data, and prepare reports to measure recruitment effectiveness and identify areas for improvement. Collaborate with HR leadership to develop and implement talent acquisition strategies aligned with organizational goals and values. Qualifications: Masters in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Strong understanding of recruitment processes, sourcing techniques, and candidate assessment methods. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.

column2: Ready to help build IBM's biggest asset - its talent? As a Talent Acquisition Partner at IBM, you serve an integral role as the main point of contact for both candidates and hiring managers, guiding them through the full recruiting lifecycle. Work with a team using the most innovative approaches to attraction, sourcing, selection, interviewing, offering, and closing. This is an opportunity to shape IBM's future. If you love the dynamics of the hiring domain and have deep recruiting experience in areas of Consulting, Sales and Go-to market roles , we would love to talk to you ! Your Role and Responsibilities As the Talent Acquisition Partner - Sales & Consulting you will establish and oversee the full life cycle of the hiring process for all go-to-market roles within defined Business Units in India. The hiring process for go-to-market roles includes highly developed skills in developing search strategies, market mapping, name generation, cold calling, candidate attraction, interviewing, assessment, offer preparation extension onboarding and client management. You will partner with senior business leaders in IBM to gain a deep understanding of business needs and challenges and translate into position requirements and develop strategies to identity and attract top-tier diverse talent. Own the end-to-end recruitment cycle for Consulting, Sales and Go-to-market roles. Interview candidates within the framework of the position specification. Possess strong ability to screen, interview and prepare an ideal candidate slate within an appropriate and consistent timeline Manage recruitment activities from the discovery stage to sourcing, screening, interviewing and offer negotiations, till such time that the candidate is onboard.  Build detailed hiring plan with deliverables, timelines and a formal tracking process/reporting/metrics Develop a strong relationship with the Business Leaders/ Hiring Managers Provide advice and counsel on job descriptions. Research, build and report on competitive and market driven insights/ market mapping to help hiring managers better understand their unique talent markets. Build talent pipelines, own and nurture candidate relationships - to ensure the right talent is available when needed. Focus on effective networking methods to reach the greatest number of potential candidates through internet sourcing, direct mailing, LinkedIn, industry leads & sources, key contacts, portals, etc. Required Technical and Professional Expertise 3- 8 years of experience in full life cycle recruitment for sales & consulting roles , including management of multiple high-volume roles simultaneously.  Experiences in handling stakeholders at C-suit/CXO/ CIO level Prior experience of working with Consulting SI organizations would be a added advantage Knowledge of the Information technology industry. Ability to learn technical information. Familiar with a wide variety of sourcing avenues Advanced knowledge of a variety of recruitment tools and technologies. Comfortable making decisions independently Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Preferably with Semiconductor/System/VLSI hiring background

column2: Job Description      Channelplay is one of India's leading retail marketing companies, working with most of the world's leading mobile phone, laptop and consumer electronics brands on their retail marketing efforts in India. We've grown explosively over the last 6 years of our existence, and currently have over 3000 employees across the country delivering the best in retail marketing to our clients. A large number of Channelplay's 3000 employees are front-line sales and marketing professionals based in over 300 cities. We currently hire more than 200 people a month. The ability to hire high quality resources within aggressive timelines and through a robust recruitment process is a key competitive advantage of Channelplay. To be able to do so, we have built a team of 20 field recruitment professionals based in 20 different cities across the country. A selected candidate would be a member of that team.      Roles and Responsibilities      -Interact with multiple stakeholders to understand job descriptions, and create a pool of appropriate candidates.      -Assess and interview candidates to create a shortlist of selected candidates.      -Coordinate with various stake-holders to schedule walk-ins, one-on-one interview etc.      -Develop and manage a pool of candidates who are pre-selected for various profiles.      -Develop and manage relationships with candidate sources such as colleges, vocational institutes, local agencies etc.      Key skills required Recruitment
