column2: Ready to help build IBM's biggest asset - its talent? As a Recruitment Professional, you serve an integral role as the main point of contact for both candidates and hiring managers, guiding them through the full recruiting lifecycle. Work with a team using the most innovative approaches to attraction, sourcing, selection, interviewing, offering, and closing. This is an opportunity to shape IBM's future. Start your journey now! Your Role and Responsibilities As a recruiter at IBM Consulting , you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top talent to meet the staffing needs of the organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their staffing requirements and develop effective recruitment strategies to identify and engage qualified candidates. Key Responsibilities: Partner with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and define job requirements and specifications. Conduct job analysis to determine essential skills, experience, and qualifications for each position. Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates through various channels such as job boards, social media, networking, and employee referrals. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in recruitment to continuously improve sourcing and hiring processes. Proactively source candidates through online job postings, networking events, job fairs, and recruitment agencies. Review resumes, screen candidates, and conduct initial interviews to assess qualifications and fit for the position. Coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient interview process. Evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit with the organization and provide feedback to hiring managers. Extend job offers to successful candidates and negotiate terms and conditions of employment. Provide necessary information and support to new hires to facilitate their integration into the organization. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate information, recruitment activities, and hiring metrics using applicant tracking systems Required Technical and Professional Expertise Proven experience as a recruiter or in a similar role, preferably in IT sector Strong understanding of recruitment processes and best practices. Proven communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and deadlines. Good understanding of the industry or sector in which they are recruiting, including trends, market conditions, and competitor analysis.  Effectively targeting candidates and providing valuable insights to hiring managers. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Maintaining a strong professional network is essential for recruiters to tap into talent pools, gain referrals, and stay updated on industry trends. Adapt to new situations, embrace change, and stay agile in their approach are better equipped to succeed in the role.

Uncapped Growth Mindset:    We see all situations as opportunities to learn, grow, and improve as individuals and as an organization. Create Real Value:    We pursue the most impactful opportunities with rigor and integrity. We take intelligent risks and make disciplined trade-offs to maintain deep focus. We help our customers win by delivering durable value.            Go Further Together:    we're one team working towards one mission and vision. column2: Job Summary: The Non-IT Recruiter will be responsible for managing the full recruitment cycle for a variety of roles outside the IT sector. Key Responsibilities: Talent Sourcing: Utilize various channels to source candidates, including job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals. Provide regular updates on recruitment status and progress. Compliance and Reporting: Ensure all recruitment activities comply with company policies and legal requirements. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Generate and analyze recruitment metrics and reports. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field preferred. Experience: 2+ years of recruiting experience, preferably in non-IT roles. Proven track record of successfully filling positions across various functions and levels. Skills: Strong understanding of recruitment processes and best practices. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proficiency in using ATS and other recruitment tools. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

column2: This role involves daily stand-up meetings to discuss priorities, reviewing tickets from the previous day, conducting building walkthroughs with the CM team to inspect infrastructure and create tickets for any issues found. Effective communication with stakeholders is crucial to gather additional information and provide status updates, ensuring transparency and a high member experience.      Monitoring SLA compliance, following up on escalated tickets, and sending professional responses to resolved tickets are essential tasks.     Additionally, the role involves organizing ticket data for monthly reports, participating in discussions to improve processes and service quality, and reviewing tickets before 6 pm to update the team on high-priority issues needing attention post 6 pm or during weekends. Exceptional Member Experience: Focus on delivering outstanding service and experiences to members.         Written Communication: Utilize excellent written English skills to communicate effectively and professionally through support requests.         Hospitality Knowledge: Apply hospitality principles to enhance member satisfaction and service quality. column2: Company Description VEDAK is an expert network that provides simple, fast, and affordable access to experts through phone calls or short-term consulting assignments. Onboarding Support:  Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including paperwork completion, orientation scheduling, and assisting with any logistical needs. column2: Job DescriptionWe are looking for AWS Cloudera Administrator with 3- 5 years of experience.  A Professional with expertise and passion for building large scale distributed systems and to setup,  configure and maintain the Hadoop clusters including components such as Hive,  Impala,  Kafka,  Storm,  Kudu,  Pig,  Spark,  HDFS,  HBase,  Oozie,  Sqoop,  Flume,  Zookeeper,  etc.    Desired Knowledge and Skills:   Good knowledge of capacity planning phase i. e.  for the first time or for scheduled addition of nodes.    Being involved in the hardware requirement of the nodes,  network architecture,  and planning.    Experienced in the configuration management for the nodes   Experienced in Testing and benchmarking the new nodes in Dev,  Staging and Production clusters.    Experienced in cluster management monitoring via Cloudera Manager /  Ambari or conventional tools like Ganglia or Nagios   Hand- on experience in LINUX based system for software installation,  patch upgrades and shell scripting   Should take care of the standard System Admin work like creating new users in Hadoop,  handling permissions,  performing upgrades   Should take care of the Day to Day Cluster issues like finding out which jobs are taking more time if users say that jobs are stuck to find out the reason   Should take care of the daily supporting of users in their admin needs.  This would involve checking for heavy jobs and if some jobs are taking more time as per the SLA.    Good knowledge in the security administration during installation and for this Kerberos knowledge is required and also Apache Knox,  Apache Sentry basics will be helpful   Handling backups to the metadata of the cluster and other Eco- system metadata   Being involved in data migration between clusters if needed.    Good knowledge on AWS environment and Service knowledge such as AWS EC2,  S3,  VPC,  VPN,  Amazon API Gateway,  AWS ECS,  Elastic Container Service,  AWS RDS,  AWS Route 53 shall be preferred.    Good knowledge on AWS VPC Deployment such as Create VPC,  Subnets,  Internet Gateway,  VPC peering,  NAT Instance,  VPN server Instance (Sophos),  Create Route Tables,  Network ACL,  Cloud watch Alarms shall be preferred. Other Skills /  Responsibilities:   Translating functional and technical requirement into detailed architecture and design   Coding and testing complex system components   Participating in code and design reviews to maintain out high development standards   Able to perform technical root cause analysis and outline corrective action for given problems   Excellent verbal and written communication skills,  demonstrating the ability to communicate technology concepts to non- technology personnel   Maintain high team morale.    Adhere to company and project standards and guidelines.    Promptly escalate issues,  which affect product delivery and quality that are beyond scope of influence and report same to reporting manager.    Pay high attention to detail in all work.    Quality,  on time delivery of agreed deliverables. Educational Qualification:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

column2: Company Name: -  Alexander man solutions (AMS ) Job Title:   Recruiter specialist    Client:  British multinational universal bank, headquartered in London.   Job Location:  Goregaon, Mumbai   Work Model-  Onsite     Job Summary: As a Recruiter Specialist for the RPO (Recruitment Process Outsourcing) team, you will be responsible for managing end-to-end recruitment activities for the corporate team and clients. You will work closely with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand their staffing needs and identify qualified candidates through various sourcing methods. You will be responsible for screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates, as well as managing the entire recruitment process from sourcing to onboarding. Your expertise in the Global TA industry and knowledge of talent acquisition best practices will be crucial in identifying top talent for our client's organization.   Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand their recruitment needs and develop a comprehensive recruitment strategy for Non-IT roles (compliance, private banking, Private banker, wealth, corporate banking, global markets & Investment Banking (quant, Capital Markets, advisory, Trading) Work towards achieving monthly productivity of offers, focused on specialized positions. Ensure the recruitment service is delivered as per agreed SLAs with the client Contribute to the commercial success of the account through the achievement of NFI (monthly and annual) targets. Accountable for ensuring target number of hires join as per pre-agreed start dates. Lead discussions on open roles with hiring managers and document recruitment plans, these should include role requirements, agreed timeframes, roles and responsibilities of stakeholders involved in the selection process. Work in collaboration with the team to ensure hiring targets are met. Building and maintaining hiring manager relationships. Responsible for client satisfaction within the line of business allocated to the recruiter. Manage candidate experience effectively to achieve a high satisfaction score Skills Required: Bachelor's degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 5-9 years of experience as a recruiter, preferably in the BFSI industry. In-depth knowledge of talent acquisition best practices, including sourcing, interviewing, and assessment techniques. Strong understanding of the BFSI industry (Market research, compliance, private banking, Private banker, wealth, corporate banking, global markets & Investment Banking (quant, Capital Markets, advisory, Trading), including roles, skills, and market trends. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels. Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools. Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.

column2: Job description Overview:  US Recruiter, you will be instrumental in sourcing, assessing, and hiring top talent for our Sales and Customer Service teams. This role requires a deep understanding of the sales and customer service domains, excellent communication skills, and the ability to build strong relationships with hiring managers and candidates.   Responsibilities: Collaboration with Hiring Managers you will be responsible for working closely with Sales and Customer Service managers to understand team dynamics, staffing needs, and hiring priorities. Collaborate in the creation and refinement of job descriptions for Sales and Customer Service roles. Responsible for candidate sourcing utilize various channels, such as job boards, social media, professional networks, to proactively source and attract qualified candidates. Need to build and maintain a talent pipeline for Sales and Customer Service positions. Candidate Assessment conduct thorough interviews to evaluate candidates' qualifications, interpersonal skills, and alignment with the organization's values. Assess sales candidates for their ability to meet targets and contribute to revenue growth. Evaluate customer service candidates for effective communication, problem-solving abilities, and customer-centric values. Sales Recruitment need to Identify and attract high-performing sales professionals at various levels, from entry-level to senior positions. Collaborate with Sales managers to understand specific sales metrics, performance indicators, and key competencies. Customer Service Recruitment need to Source and recruit candidates for Customer Service roles, focusing on excellent communication skills, empathy, and the ability to provide exceptional customer experiences. Employer Branding promote and enhance our employer brand to attract top talent in the competitive sales and customer service landscape. column2: Job Title:   HR Recruiter Job Summary:  The HR Recruiter plays a pivotal role in the recruitment process by providing administrative support to the Talent Acquisition team. This individual assists in the coordination of various recruitment activities, from sourcing candidates to onboarding new hires. The ideal candidate possesses excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Skills/Requirements/Roles & Responsibilities Candidate Sourcing:  Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, and networking, to attract potential candidates. Resume Screening:  Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates for open positions. Scheduling Interviews:  Coordinate interview schedules between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient process. Interview Support:  Assist in the coordination of interview logistics, such as booking meeting rooms, preparing interview materials, and communicating with candidates. Candidate Communication:  Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates and feedback as needed. Reference Checks:  Conduct reference checks for selected candidates, verifying employment history and qualifications. Offer Processing:  Assist in the preparation and processing of employment offers, including generating offer letters and coordinating with the relevant stakeholders. Onboarding Support:  Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including paperwork completion, orientation scheduling, and assisting with any logistical needs. column2: Karo Sambhav is looking for Social Entrepreneur to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Social Entrepreneur is a visionary leader who identifies social or environmental problems and creates innovative, sustainable solutions to address them      The primary focus is on creating positive social impact while also achieving financial sustainability        Key Responsibilities:        Problem Identification and Analysis:Identify pressing social or environmental issues within communities or society at large      Conduct research and analysis to understand the root causes and consequences of these problems      Utilize data-driven insights and stakeholder feedback to inform solution development      Innovative Solution Design:Develop creative and impactful solutions that address identified problems effectively      Collaborate with stakeholders, including community members, experts, and organizations, to co-create solutions that are contextually relevant and sustainable      Leverage technology, business models, and interdisciplinary approaches to innovate and scale solutions      Business Planning and Implementation:Develop a business plan that outlines the mission, vision, goals, target beneficiaries, revenue model, and scalability strategy      Secure funding and resources through grants, investments, partnerships, or crowdfunding to support solution implementation      Establish and manage the operations, logistics, and organizational structure necessary to execute the business plan effectively      Impact Measurement and Evaluation:Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track the social, environmental, and financial impact of the venture      Implement monitoring and evaluation processes to assess progress, identify areas for improvement, and measure outcomes against set goals      Use impact data to demonstrate accountability, transparency, and effectiveness to stakeholders, funders, and partners      Community Engagement and Advocacy:Build strong relationships with stakeholders, including beneficiaries, local communities, government agencies, NGOs, and businesses      Foster community engagement and participation in solution development, implementation, and decision-making processes      Advocate for policy changes and systemic reforms that support the advancement of social and environmental goals

column2: This role is NOT a regular Recruitment role. It is pure sales (where younegotiate and convince) and customer oriented role where you acquire and managea portfolio of 50-100 IT Professionals (your clients for whom you obsess) andensure they get selected for the most suitable for them projects with EuropeanInstitutions across Europe.          Relationship building, high quality expert advice on projects EuropeanTaxation is the key to success here.                      When you join us, this is how your day will look like:                    You take 2-4 scheduled daily interviewswith IT Professionals (experts in Java, .Net, PHP tech stacks) from 22 Europeancountries.                          During your calls you use yourexpertise on the EU projects and taxes (we provide you with the full process,tools, training, and materials) to convince IT professionals in the benefits ofjoining your projects.                          You followup daily with yourIT Professionals Portfolio in regard to sharing new projects or helping your portfoliocandidates with creating their CV (it s a special, custom made CV that each candidateneed to prepare).                          You work with tight deadlinesand you need to introduce your top (most interested) candidates along withtheir perfectly prepared CV to the client within the time frames of thedelivery deadline.                          You close the day by achievingyour daily targets and feeling fulfilled.          At IT World Web.com we are driven by data, results, and performance.Achieving your quarterly targets pushes you closer towards promotion andreceiving a quarterly bonus.          Have you always been dreaming of that company which provides you a trulyclear career path with clear targets and what you need to do to get promoted        Well, great news, look no further. This is what the success of IT WorldWeb.com is all about. We believe in the philosophy that every 2 years our womenneed to excel and by raising the bar higher move into a higher level role withmore responsibilities. You know at any point (every hour, every day) what yourtarget is and what you need to do to get there. And because we believe thatambitious women should never stop learning, we have put into place Academy (ourlearning platform), a Fast Track Program (for the top performers) and peercoaching.                    What we expect you to bring in, so you can be successful in your careerpath with us:              Excellent communication skill in writing and speech          Negotiating with and convincing your stakeholders excites you and you want to be the best at it          Achieving set daily targets excites you.          You are super curious and eager to learn          You never accept " NO" for an answer          You are unstoppable in your career ambitions. You dream of: becoming an Expert in your field, lead a team and grow into Leadership roles where you impact our 100+ women organization with your ideas, knowledge and vision.

column2: Description Quotient Technology is growing,   and we are looking for a full cycle Recruiter to lead efforts across our Analytics,   Data and Business Development organizations and report into the Sr. Manager,   Talent Acquisition. Along with leading all recruiting efforts,   you will also partner closely with the SVP,   Analytics,   RVP,   Business Development,   and VP,   Data Partnerships to build out their talent acquisition strategy. This person will be the subject matter expert for all things recruiting for these departments and be a Quotient Brand Ambassador.    What you will do:    Full cycle recruiting for all Analytics,   Data and Business Development experts with the ability to pick up other high priority positions during high ramp of hiring across the organization.    Deep integration within the organization and overall knowledge of business strategy,   product roll- outs,   etc.    Develop innovative sourcing solutions and map out top leads for regions where Quotient Technology is most actively growing    Recommend,   communicate and execute on recruitment strategy    Facilitate and lead key initiatives and projects with recruiting team,   stakeholders and hiring partners    Partner with Quotient hiring managers to develop a detailed profile of target candidates with data- driven advice on the range of logical possibilities.    Effective pre- screening of candidates,   and collaboration with hiring managers to engage Top 20- percenters to interview    Manage interview process,   ensuring great candidate experience,   from first interview to final negotiation and close    Continued market research on competition; we re looking for the best people to join Quotient,   and solid understanding of our competitive landscape will be essential to success in this role. What you ll bring:    Bachelor s Degree or equivalent experience    5+ years in a full life cycle recruiting role within a corporate environment or agency firm. Experience working at a publicly- held company highly preferred    Digital media industry knowledge a plus    Demonstrated track record of building relationships with leaders and cross- functional partners    Experience building and refining an effective recruiting process tailored to meet current business needs.    Ability to be adaptable to shifting prioritizations    High level of ownership and entrepreneurial spirit    Someone who enjoys fast- paced start- up environment,   and who enjoys making a huge impact along the way!    Someone with high attention to detail and strong work ethic    Experience with Jobvite a plus

column2: An IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-quality IT talent for an organization. The primary responsibilities of this role include:     Sourcing and identifying potential candidates: The IT Recruiter is responsible for sourcing and identifying potential candidates through various channels such as job boards, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Screening and interviewing candidates: The IT Recruiter will screen and interview candidates to assess their technical abilities, work experience, and overall fit for the organization.     Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified candidates: The IT Recruiter will build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings.     Negotiating offers: The IT Recruiter will negotiate offers with successful candidates, ensuring that compensation and benefits packages are competitive and in line with industry standards.     Onboarding and integration: The IT Recruiter will support the onboarding and integration process for new hires, ensuring that they have a smooth transition into their new role and organization.     Reporting and data analysis: The IT Recruiter will collect and analyze data on recruiting metrics and provide regular reports to management on their findings.     The ideal candidate for this role should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as experience in IT recruitment.      They should have a good understanding of various technical roles and technologies, and be able to quickly assess the technical abilities of potential candidates.     Experience in IT recruitment, sourcing, and talent acquisition.     Familiarity with various applicant tracking systems (ATS) and candidate sourcing tools is also desirable
column11: Data analysis, Talent acquisition, Transition, Packaging, Management, IT recruitment, Recruitment

column2: Job Description      Channelplay is one of India's leading retail marketing companies, working with most of the world's leading mobile phone, laptop and consumer electronics brands on their retail marketing efforts in India. We've grown explosively over the last 6 years of our existence, and currently have over 3000 employees across the country delivering the best in retail marketing to our clients. A large number of Channelplay's 3000 employees are front-line sales and marketing professionals based in over 300 cities. We currently hire more than 200 people a month. The ability to hire high quality resources within aggressive timelines and through a robust recruitment process is a key competitive advantage of Channelplay. To be able to do so, we have built a team of 20 field recruitment professionals based in 20 different cities across the country. A selected candidate would be a member of that team.      Roles and Responsibilities -Interact with multiple stakeholders to understand job descriptions, and create a pool of appropriate candidates. -Assess and interview candidates to create a shortlist of selected candidates. -Coordinate with various stake-holders to schedule walk-ins, one-on-one interview etc. -Develop and manage a pool of candidates who are pre-selected for various profiles. -Develop and manage relationships with candidate sources such as colleges, vocational institutes, local agencies etc.      Key skills required Recruitment

column2: Primary role         We are looking for a Recruiter to join our team in identifying, screening, and hiring top talent across roles in our US and UK regions.     In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing both active and passive candidates and cultivating a pipeline of best-in-class talent for Odessa through innovative outreach methods.      Reporting to the Talent Acquisition Manager, you will craft sourcing strategies for various roles including leadership positions.      You will ensure that we provide an excellent candidate experience, while meeting our business goals and filling our vacancies. Ultimately, you will build a strong employer brand for Odessa, to help create strong talent pipelines for current and future talent needs.      You will need to thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment, can roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done.          What youll do         Identify and engage with both passive and active talent through use of multiple channels and methods. Including, but not exclusive to, LinkedIn, Boolean, Social media.          Proactively build talent pipelines for Technology roles          Create successful sourcing strategies using multiple resources tailored to individual business needs and markets          Conduct detailed candidate screening conversations to qualify prospects for roles          Maintain pipeline funnel metrics and KPIs          Utilise our tools to provide talent market insights and data to influence decisions          Recommend and drive improvements that impact talent pipelines          Lead and prioritise efforts of diversity and inclusion          Create and own an amazing candidate and new hire experience!          Qualifications          2+ years of progressively responsible experience talent acquisition          1+ years of experience working for a product software company or in financial services firm.          Understanding of US, UK talent market          Bachelor s degree in business, accounting, economics, technology, or psychology          Preferred qualifications         Experience in hiring Microsoft Technologies, for Product organizations

column2: Jr. Recruiter/Recruiter   Non-IT US Staffing   SPECTRAFORCE was founded in 2004 and is now one of the largest staffing firms in the United States. We set up operations and support staffing in India to better serve many of the US-based industries of which SPECTRA FORCE  clients are a part, including Finance, IT, Energy/Utilities, Pharma/Life Sciences, and Business and Professional Services. Our world-class Indian team is essential to the continuous expansion of our global sales and delivery. A Global Staffing and IT company, SPECTRAFORCE is human-to-human driven. Its branding tagline, NEWJOBPHORIA, encompasses the excitement generated within people by matching them with jobs that align on multiple levels: skills, motivation, and environment. As a certified Minority Business Enterprise, SPECTRAFORCE celebrates how different perspectives benefit our employees, services, and community. We focus on cultivating a diverse and inclusive work environment that encourages collaboration and connection. Together, these unique perspectives bring great offerings that deliver state-of-the-art services to our clients and employees.   The Recruiter will join our team in India. This person must be confident and willing to jump into a fast-paced and ambitious environment, where they will be given the opportunity to work independently and take ownership of various initiatives. This is a unique opportunity to work with one of the fastest-growing staffing companies and be a part of an energetic, dedicated, and passionate team.   Key Responsibilities: Responsible for full life cycle recruiting including direct sourcing activities, preliminary phone interviewing, and negotiation of compensation packages. The concerned person would need to make a large number of phone calls. Responsible for bulk hiring for customer service roles, which constitute approximately 80-90% of the positions. Occasionally, there will be administrative positions too. Overall hiring will be for clients companies only (insurance and financial clients). May need to work on alternate Saturdays during the peak season, as per business requirements. Recruiting through Internet job portals combined with utilizing existing candidate relationships and referrals, along with various Internet sourcing techniques. Screening candidates based on the resource managers job description, relevant knowledge, and experience for required skill sets, functional skills, and communication skills. Regular follow-up from first Contact till the offer letter is extended to the candidate. Coordinate salary expectations, counteroffers, benefits, and interviews. Reference check for the candidate to ensure their authenticity and relevance. Responsible for sourcing, screening, and interviewing candidates, checking references, and updating job boards.     Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes: Flexible & Aggressive. Excellent communication skills (Spoken and Written). Work independently with little supervision in a fast-paced agency environment. Have a knack for learning and staying up to date with new technologies. Professional, Adaptable, and Resilient - able to take no for an answer yet still apply 100% effort throughout the workday. Goal-oriented; have a burning desire to be successful. Advanced computer skills especially Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, and Outlook. A highly motivated individual, able to grasp complex technologies, tools, or knowledge and learn quickly. Must have a demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines. Willing to work night shifts.    Benefits & Perks: Incentives* Monetary Awards* 5-Year Retention Bonus Referral Policy* Internet Reimbursement* Router UPS Reimbursement* Term Life Insurance Accidental Insurance Group Medical Insurance (Family Floater) On-call doctor support  COVID Protocols Sodexo Benefit Leave Policy EWAP - Employee Wellbeing and Assistance Program NPS - National Pension Scheme LTA Leave Travel allowance  Leave Encashment Bank Assistance Employee's State Insurance* Gratuity Provident Fund Cab facility   *Admissibility of the benefit may vary commensurate the department, designation, and role.

column2: We are Looking for    Talent Acquisition Specialist with Event Management Industry Expertise is a pivotal role within the HR team, responsible for spearheading talent acquisition efforts while leveraging specialized knowledge of the event management industry.                This role involves developing strategic recruitment plans, sourcing top-tier talent, and implementing innovative hiring strategies tailored to the unique needs and challenges of the event management sector.                The incumbent will play a key role in attracting, engaging, and retaining high-caliber professionals to drive organizational success.              Key Responsibilities:     ?     1. Recruitment Strategy Development:     ?     - Work closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their staffing needs, job requirements, and team    Clear       dynamics.     - Develop comprehensive recruitment strategies for various non-IT roles, considering different sourcing channels and     candidate pools.           2. Sourcing and Candidate Identification:     ?     - Utilize various sourcing methods such as job boards, social media, networking events, referrals, and direct sourcing to     identify potential candidates.     - Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitor practices.     3. Candidate Screening and Assessment:     4. Interview Coordination.     5.Candidate Relationship Management: -Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, keeping them informed about their application status.     6.Offer Management and Negotiation:     7.Data and Reporting:- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate interactions and recruitment activities in the applicant tracking system (ATS). - Generate recruitment metrics and reports to analyze the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and identify areas for improvement.           Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or a related field (Masters degree preferred). Proven track record of sourcing and hiring top talent within the event management industry, including event planners, coordinators, and production professionals.     Strong networking and relationship-building skills, with the ability to engage with industry professionals, associations, and talent communities.     Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with a customer-centric approach to recruitment. column2: As a Sourcing Specialist and Recruitment Coordinator, you will play a pivotal role in talent acquisition by combining proactive sourcing strategies with efficient coordination throughout the recruitment process. Your responsibilities will include identifying and engaging potential candidates, managing candidate pipelines, and coordinating various recruitment activities to ensure a smooth and effective hiring process.                                    ?         Key Responsibilities:                              ?         Sourcing:              Utilize various sourcing techniques (e.g., social media, job boards, networking) to identify and attract top talent.          Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging talent pools.          Build and maintain a robust talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs.              Candidate Engagement:              Communicate effectively with potential candidates, providing information about the company, job opportunities, and the overall recruitment process.          Nurture relationships with passive candidates through consistent and meaningful interactions.          Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their specific needs and preferences in potential candidates.              Recruitment Coordination:              Manage end-to-end recruitment coordination, including scheduling interviews, coordinating assessments, and facilitating candidate communication.          Ensure a positive candidate experience by providing timely and relevant information, addressing queries, and managing logistics for interviews.          Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline recruitment processes and enhance overall efficiency.              Data Management:              Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate information, interview feedback, and recruitment metrics.          Generate reports and analytics to track the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and recruitment efforts.              Employer Branding:              Contribute to the development and execution of employer branding initiatives to attract top talent.          Represent the organization at industry events, job fairs, and other networking opportunities.              Qualifications and Skills:              Bachelor s degree in Human Resources      , Business Administration, or a related field.          Proven experience in both sourcing and recruitment coordination roles.          Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment tools.          Strong interpersonal and communication skills.          Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.          Understanding of employment laws and regulations.              Personal Attributes:              Proactive and self-motivated.          Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.          Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively.          Adaptability to evolving recruitment trends and industry changes.

column2: About Spinny: Founded in 2015, Spinny is a used car retailing platform that aims to bring about transparency and convenience in the car buying and selling process in India. Spinny operates across the entire value chain of pre-owned cars, embedding superior technology and processes to deliver a premium experience to customers. As a testimony of Spinny's commitment to transparency and quality, every car on the Spinny platform comes with a 200-point inspection checklist, 5-day no questions asked money-back guarantee, and 1-year after-sales warranty. Spinny is backed by leading global venture firms - Tiger Global, ADQ, Avenir Growth, Accel Partners, and Elevation Capital, and is currently valued at ~ USD 1.8 Bn. Currently, Spinny has 35 car hubs that operate across 15 cities - Delhi, Gurugram, Noida, Bangalore, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Jaipur, Chandigarh, Indore, and Coimbatore. Spinny Max is a category within the company focusing on the resale of used luxury cars, targeting yet another market within the used-car industry.  About the role: The role includes sourcing by using different job portals, screening & closing the requirement  within time. Ideal Candidate: An ideal candidate would be a hardworking and enterprising individual, with excellent analytical and communication skills. Interested candidates must have an ingenious, scientific approach to problems, backed by a strong outcome-oriented point of view. They must also have demonstrated experience to show that they are skilled at negotiation and communication.  Key Responsibilities Include: Coordinating with hiring managers to identify staffing needs. Determining appropriate selection criteria Sourcing potential candidates through online channels Planning interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments, and in-person interviews. Designing interview questions that reflect the positions requirements. Fostering long-term relationships and building a network of past applicants and potential candidates Requirements: Excellent communication skills 0-2 years of experience as a Talent Acquisition specialist  College degree Familiarity with social media, resume databases, and professional networks  Should know languages  Tamil  other than Hindi or English. Interested candidates can also share their resume at ananya.gupta@spinny.com Regards,  Ananya Gupta 9131870503 (Call)

column2: Job Overview:* We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced HR Recruiter to join our Human Resources team. The HR Recruiter will be responsible for managing the full recruitment cycle to attract, hire, and retain the best talent. This role requires excellent communication skills, a deep understanding of recruitment processes, and a commitment to maintaining a positive candidate experience. *Key Responsibilities:*  *Talent Acquisition:*   - Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract a diverse pool of qualified       candidates for various positions.   - Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g., social platforms, job boards).   - Conduct preliminary interviews to assess candidates qualifications and cultural fit.   - Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers. *Candidate Management:*   - Manage candidate communications and ensure a positive experience throughout the       recruitment process.   - Maintain a database of potential candidates for future job openings.   - Provide feedback to candidates and handle offer negotiations.  *Collaboration and Coordination:*   - Partner with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and job specifications.   - Assist in the development of job descriptions and specifications.   - Work with the HR team to improve the recruitment process and employer brand. *Administrative Duties:*   - Prepare and maintain recruitment metrics and reports.   - Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements.   - Assist in organizing and attending job fairs and other recruitment event. - *Skills and Competencies:*   - Excellent verbal and written communication skills.   - Strong organizational and time-management abilities.   - Proficiency in using social media and professional tools for recruiting.   - Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks.   - Strong decision-making skills.  *Preferred Qualifications:* - Must be a graduate/HR MBA, or a related field. - Experience recruiting for a variety of roles, including financial/technical positions. - Proven experience as an HR Recruiter or similar role (1-3 years preferred).

column2: The Junior HR Recruiter is responsible for assisting the HR department in attracting and selecting top talent for our organization     This role involves working closely with hiring managers, posting job openings, screening resumes, conducting initial interviews, and coordinating the overall recruitment process     The Junior HR Recruiter will also assist in various HR-related activities as needed       Key Responsibilities:       Job Posting and Advertising:Create and post job advertisements on various job boards, company website, and social media platforms     Ensure job postings are up-to-date and accurately reflect the job requirements     Resume Screening:Review resumes and applications to shortlist qualified candidates     Maintain an organized and efficient applicant tracking system     Interview Coordination:Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers     Communicate interview details to candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience     Candidate Communication:Keep candidates informed about their application status     Respond to candidate inquiries and provide necessary information     Candidate Assessment:Conduct initial phone or video interviews to assess candidates' qualifications and cultural fit     Provide feedback and recommendations to hiring managers     Reference Checks:Verify candidate references as required     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate records of candidate information and interview outcomes     Generate recruitment reports and metrics as needed     Compliance:Ensure recruitment processes adhere to all relevant labor laws and regulations

column2: As a Talent Acquisition Professional, you support the strategic direction and governance for APAC and Middle East Meta Region.          You define global standards and design efficient and cost-effective concepts to position Innomotics as an employer of choice.          You act as program manager for our global/regional programs, including involvement in workforce planning, recruiting strategy, campus hiring, selection, smooth onboarding, talent attraction and market mapping.          In order to push boundaries every day, we have high demands and aim to continuously reinvent ourselves.          You monitor labour market trends, workforce challenges and regional/local business needs and ensure the introduction of forward-thinking and innovative methodologies          You will drive the Talent Acquisition strategy while also focusing on building diversity in sourcing the right Talent for the organization through various job seeker pools including building a stronger Campus, Job board recruitment strategy.          An integral part of your role will be to build and maintain strategic relationships with key partners in the relevant business and P&O organisation and external partners. Here, you ll develop medium-term to long-term TA strategies for the business ensuring that talent acquisition projects are aligned with the organizational goals.          Encouraging a culture of excellence and developing clear objectives for TA in alignment with business aspirations.          You ensure the design and implementation of technical and organisational TA infrastructure and processes for effective international TA management.          Ensure selection and effective cooperation with global or regional TA service providers, negotiate respective contracts, and approve respective work deliveries.          You ensure effective support and partnering with regional stakeholders and P&O management, in all TA-related matters.          You ensure the definition and design of consistent employee marketing standards and programs and monitor its implementation.          Decide on the right strategy to optimize the source mix for hiring candidates through the internal TA team / via partner and periodic reporting to the management on the overall source mix and spending.          Responsible for preparing the TA dashboard monthly and quarterly.                  What you need to make real what matters.            You will succeed in this role in transformingTalent Acquisition by your expertise in designing and enabling the organizationby attracting, engaging, and retaining the best talent as per the businessrequirement.            Post Graduate Degree in Human Resources Management or related field          10+ years of work experience and a successful track record as a TA professional with global responsibilities preferably in Asia Pacific and Middle East Regions.          You enjoy building trusted relationships and have strong interpersonal skills at all organisational levels          You bring strong project management skills and love to work in a project-driven environment          You show a clear aspiration to be a trusted business advisor and partner with exceptional communication and strong stakeholder management capabilities.              You re self-motivated with highlearning agility, deal well with change and show high resilience in a fast-pacedenvironment.          You have exposure to hire inthe global talent market working with different channels and sources of talentincluding search partners, universities, placement heads, diversity hiringpartners within Asia Pacific and the Middle East Region.          You have strong experience on leadershiphiring, niche hiring with sizable volume and across functions and levels in theregions.          High level of understanding jobrequirements and ability to source the right candidates within an appropriatetimeline to support the business requirement.          Can operate in a highly matrixedenvironment with a high degree of cultural competence.          Complete responsibility ofOnboarding within Asia Pacific and Middle East region to ensure smooth day one readinessof the candidate.          Drive various initiatives andprojects within P&O Asia Pacific and Middle East region.

column2: As a recruiter in our Mumbai facility youll have the opportunity to leverage and enhance your recruiting skills to fill mostly positions with our Direct Client.             Youll manage a full life cycle recruitment process creating / posting job ads, souring candidates, conducting interviews, extending offers, etc. Most of our positions arent easy to fill, so "post and pray " doesnt often work.             Youll need to be creative and assertive in sourcing and attracting right talent.             Youll lead our managers through the recruitment sourcing and selecting right quality consultants, should have an process in place ensuring all job requirements, company policies and affirmative action guidelines are met.             You must meet these requirements to be considered:             Minimum 6 Months To 6 yearsa TM of experience in US IT Recruiting             Experience well versed with Corp to Corp W2 Tax Terms should possess knowledge about H1B/EADGC/GC/Citizens process.             Proven experience in both Contract/ Permanent Assignments.             Experience working with Dice/Monster/Tech-Fetch and Skilled enough to source qualified candidates from Social Networking sites.             Ability to meet the deadlines in an efficient manner with turnaround time             Ability to communicate effectively             Well-developed interpersonal skills to negotiate with consultants in various IT-Non IT requisitions that we have for our clients.             Effective communication is critical to your success.

column2: Position Overview:       The SEA HR Assistant will collaborate with and support the SEA Talent team to ensure our people processes including recruiting, allocations, training, performance reviews, and HR operations run smoothly, effectively, and efficiently.       Key Relationships:         Directly reports to: SEA Talent Manager, Staffing Manager         Dotted line: SEA Head of Talent         Additional reporting relationships: SEA partners and staff, who are located across the Singapore and Mumbai office locations         Major Responsibilities:       The major responsibilities of the HR Assistant role will focus upon, but may not be limited to, the following activities:       Provide support on SAP and ensure it is up to date with the latest allocation     Support SEA Staffing Manager with coordination as and when necessary     Performance review evaluation support     Case reviews: administer the case review process to ensure all case reviews are triggered and completed within 1 week of case ending     Summary reviews: administer the summary review process to ensure all case reviews are delivered prior to the summary review round table; organise summary review meetings     Support with scheduling of roundtables as well as review delivery meetings     Preparation of compensation letters       Talent Lifecycle Support       Maintain the LEK HR system (SeLEK.t HR) and ensure it is up to date with the hiring s and people movements     Recruiting interview process: assist in scheduling interviews for all potential candidates; ensure all branding material is prepared ahead of campus recruitment and for interview day (e.g. Interviewer pro    New employees: Preparation of offer letters for all new employees; ensure new employees are properly set up and high data integrity our systems (e.g., SelektHR, SAP)     Resignations: manage the resignation process (e.g., returning of passes, deactivation of benefits, schedule exit interview)       Operational Support       Manage all insurance-related issues for employees (e.g. claims, initial sign-up, etc.)     AMEX enrolment     Organisation and scheduling of all key Talent events (e.g. training sessions)         Candidate Requirements:         Strong organisational skills and the ability to prioritise multiple tasks in a face-paced environment         Excellent interpersonal skills; approachable and possessing the ability to build strong relationships both internally and externally         Ability to collaborate effectively with the team         A passion to learn and excel         A high level of professionalism, enthusiasm, and a positive team player         Candidate Qualifications         1-2 years of experience in the field of Human Resource Management         Basic understanding of concepts of Human Resource Management         Previous experience in a professional services environment, with experience at a consulting/ advisory firm preferred but not necessary         Track record of effectively collaborating with others         Effective written and oral communications skills         Familiarity and experience with Excel

column2: The Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist NonIT plays a critical role in sourcing, attracting, and selecting qualified candidates for various noninformation technology IT positions within our organization     This position requires collaborating with hiring managers, understanding their staffing needs, and implementing effective recruitment strategies to acquire toptier talent across different departments and functions             Key Responsibilities:                Recruitment Strategy Development:    nbsp;Collaborate with hiring managers and department heads to understand staffing needs, job requirements, and team dynamics. Develop comprehensive recruitment strategies for nonIT roles by considering various sourcing channels and candidate pools.                Sourcing and Candidate Identification:    nbsp;Utilize diverse sourcing methods such as job boards, social media, networking events, referrals, and direct sourcing to identify potential candidates. Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitor practices.                Candidate Screening and Assessment:    nbsp;Review resumes and applications to identify candidates who meet job requirements and organizational culture fit. Conduct initial phone screenings and interviews to assess candidates qualifications, motivations, and alignment with company values.                Interview Coordination:    nbsp;Arrange and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring teams. Provide guidance and support to hiring managers in conducting effective interviews, including developing interview questions and evaluation criteria.                Candidate Relationship Management:    nbsp;Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, keeping them informed about their application status. Provide a positive candidate experience by promptly addressing questions, concerns, and feedback.                Employer Branding:    nbsp;Represent the organization in a positive and professional manner, both online and offline. Participate in employer branding initiatives to enhance the companys reputation as an employer of choice.                Offer Management and Negotiation:    nbsp;Extend job offers to selected candidates and negotiate compensation packages within established guidelines. Collaborate with HR and legal teams to ensure the accuracy and compliance of employment offers and related documentation.                Data and Reporting:    nbsp;Maintain accurate and uptodate records of candidate interactions and recruitment activities in the applicant tracking system ATS. Generate recruitment metrics and reports to analyze the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and identify areas for improvement.                Collaboration and Continuous Improvement:    nbsp;Collaborate with crossfunctional teams, including HR, hiring managers, and senior leadership, to align recruitment efforts with overall business goals. Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging recruitment trends to continuously improve the talent acquisition process.              Qualifications and Requirements:              Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field or equivalent experience.              Proven experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist or Recruiter, preferably in nonIT sectors.              Strong understanding of recruitment processes, techniques, and tools.              Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.              Familiarity with applicant tracking systems ATS and other recruitment software.              Ability to handle multiple priorities and work in a fastpaced environment.              High level of professionalism, ethics, and integrity

column2: Job Title: BPO Recruiter Location:  Greater Noida West About Us:  NR Consulting is a leading provider of outsourcing solutions, specializing in business process outsourcing services. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional talent to our clients and fostering a collaborative and dynamic work environment. Job Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented BPO Recruiter with experience in hiring international voice processes to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the BPO industry and proven experience in full-cycle recruitment. Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies. Source, screen, and interview candidates for various BPO roles, including customer service representatives, technical support specialists, and team leaders, with a focus on international voice processes. Utilize online job boards, social media, networking, and other channels to attract qualified candidates. Conduct preliminary interviews to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and facilitate the interview process. Manage candidate pipelines and maintain accurate recruitment data in the applicant tracking system. Extend job offers and negotiate terms of employment with selected candidates. Build and maintain relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and external recruitment partners. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and recruitment tools to enhance the recruitment process. Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to streamline recruitment processes and enhance the candidate experience. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience as a recruiter in the BPO industry or similar environment, with a focus on international voice processes. Strong understanding of BPO operations and job roles within the industry. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools. High level of professionalism and integrity. Results-oriented with a focus on delivering quality hires. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and business needs. Benefits:  Medical Insurance, Paid Leaves, etc. Join Our Team:  If you are passionate about recruiting and thrive in a dynamic environment, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the perfect fit for this role.

column2: Were looking for an enthusiastic individual keen to dive into the dynamic world of headhunting for the US market.      Even if youre new to the industry, wed love to hear from you if you possess a go-getter attitude, natural people skills, and a strong drive to succeed.            Responsibilities:        Market Research: Use various tools, databases, and networking platforms to identify potential clients for specialised roles.      Initial Contact: Reach out to potential candidates, understand their current career situations, and gauge their interest in new opportunities.      Relationship Building: Cultivate strong relationships with professionals in the industry to facilitate future engagements and referrals.      Client Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams and external clients to comprehend job specifications and ideal candidate profiles.      Ongoing Learning: Continually update knowledge on industry trends, emerging roles, and recruitment best practices.      Documentation: Maintain meticulous records of interactions, feedback, and details in the database records.              Qualifications:        A bachelors degree is an advantage but not essential.      Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities.      A proactive mindset, able to anticipate needs and act decisively.      Familiarity with MS Office and knowledge of applicant tracking systems (ATS) is a plus.      Strong organisational skills and a detail-oriented nature.      Ability to adapt to the dynamic nature of the recruitment world.      Must be willing to work according to US time zones              Benefits:        Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.      Comprehensive training programme.      Health and dental benefits.      Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.      Friendly and collaborative work environment.      Based on performance, you will have the opportunity to work on-site              Desired Attributes:        Were on the hunt for driven individuals with a fervent passion and a readiness to go above and beyond. We value those eager to learn, grow, and contribute significantly to the expansion of ATCs staffing division.      Seeking dynamic go-getters with a proactive mindset.      This isnt your typical 9-to-5 role. We envision you as our future manager and leader within the next five years.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Why a Recruiter can't earn like IIMs....? A growth opportunity like never before.. First time here is a company where you can have salary increment every month. What is special? #  You can upgrade your salary by yourself on every month/quarter?  #  Your boss do not have any role in your appraisal system? #  Salary appraisal opportunity comes every month, so need to wait for full year, 12 months -12 Salary Increment till the time you reach at 12 lakh p.a. of CTC  K R A  # First and foremost roles & responsibility is hiring for clients.  # Sourcing unique profiles which are not available on any job portal.  # Learn, explore and adopt the modern and latest technology in recruitment.  # Manage end-to-end recruitment process starting from sourcing, ensure attendance of candidate in interview, offer negotiation, timely joining and retention completion.  # Client co-ordination and ensure their high level of satisfaction.  # Adherence to TAT / SLA with client for hiring.  Added responsibilities if want to apply for Team Leader role  # Team recruitment, their training and development.  # Ensure target achievement of all team members.  # Making new clients to ensure regular requirement flow for growing team size.  # Ensure no. of internal team size is maintained as per approved budget.  # Ensure team is getting promoted on due time and earning huge incentives. Desired Candidate Profile   # Only candidate those who are looking for long term career in hardcore recruitment please apply. # Currently working in any reputed recruitment firm. # Must be highly skilled and equipped with modern technology of recruitment. # We have large no. of openings Team Handling as well as Individual role both may apply. # Working on any ATS / RMS or any other Recruitment Software will have an edge. # Generalist role is not at all a right fit. Anyone who want to move from Generalist to Recruitment may apply but there are possibility of stiff negotiation on your current package. Based upon your fitment and selection. # Candidates from West Delhi or willing to relocate to West Delhi only pl. apply. # Frequent job changer will not match with this opening. For interactive session share your CV on  WhatsApp  :  89019 51515 ( CHAT  only) You may use this link to chat on WhatsApp: https://wa.me/918901951515 Or mail  your CV on  apply@fhc.co.in  to catch special attention. Pl. mention your current and expect CTC with joining time. * Candidate interviewed in last one year will not be entertained. * STRICTLY NO RE-HIRING. Perks and Benefits   Fixed Performance Pay + Incentive + Car + Gifts + Other benefits

Role & responsibilities:- End to end recruitment for IT and Non- IT recruitment Handling full cycle of recruitment from requirement understanding to sourcing of candidates through an in-house database, using job portals, and referrals. Short-listing the candidates based on the requirement. Prepare candidates for client interviews by providing them pertinent information on the job requirement, hiring managers, team environment, and client company background. Preferred candidate profile:- Fresher & Experience both can Apply/- Any Graduate & Post Graduate Can Apply/- Excellent communication skills/- Self-Motivated and team building skills/- Immediate Joiner/- Perks and benefits Full Time  Part Time HR Interns  Monthly Incentive Performance Bonus Paid Leaves  Team incentives Yearly Bonus Day Shifts Prior experience in BPO or recruitment or customer service or sales will be an advantage. column1: Work from Home Recruiter - NON IT
column2: JOB   DESCRIPTION   DOCUMENT ABOUT   US We are a mid to senior level executive firm based out of Delhi being helmed by experienced top TA professionals qualified from premium B schools and having a collective experience of more than 10 years in the domain of recruitment and selection. Primarily we are a mid to senior level executive search firm but recently we have also ventured into the space of campus hiring and volume hiring at junior levels. Our client list includes stalwarts of the engineering domain (both tech and non tech), design and infrastructure firms and leading retail houses. DESIGNATION   :  Recruitment Consultant LOCATION   :  Work From Home LINK   TO   WEBSITE   :  SPConsultants.in ROLES   AND   RESPONSIBILITIES ??Source candidates using a variety of search methods to build a robust candidate pipeline ??Screen candidates by reviewing resumes and job applications, and performing phone screenings ??Take ownership of candidate experience by designing and managing it ??Develop job postings, job descriptions, and position requirements ??Perform reference checks as need ??Facilitate the offer process by acting as bridge between candidates and companies ??Stay abreast of recruiting trends and best practices ??Manage the overall interview, selection, and closing process DESIRED   CANDIDATE   PROFILE ??Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field ??2 years of recruiting experience preferred ??Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing ??Ability to manage a wide range of relationships with a variety of  stakeholders ??Proficient in Microsoft Office ??Working knowledge of interview techniques and applicant screening methods ??Deep understanding of working of various job portals ??Familiar with a wide variety of sourcing avenues PERKS   AND   BENEFITS Fixed Salary + Incentives on closures
column11: Recruitment

column2: This position will be responsible for the entire recruitment life cycle starting from requisition to execution for various Manufacturing/Engineering/Infrastructure/Pharma Clients. Roles and Responsibilities Job Description: Will be responsible for collecting the Interview feedback & coordination.  The incumbent will be responsible for sourcing of candidates and maintaining the data base.  Posting of job on the job portals, websites, blogs and other discussion forums. Understanding and analyzing the client's manpower requirements in different skill set categories. Responsible for mapping external talent pools to critical positions and creating a healthy pipeline. Using sourcing strategies like Referral generation, Direct Sourcing, social media, Networking, Mass Mailing so as to reach out to a maximum qualified pool of candidates. Using Online Database (Job Portals) & Offline Database to find out technically fit resources. Telephonic/Online Interviewing of the prospective candidates for accessing their Technical Fitment, Cultural Fitment, Stability etc. Conducting preliminary interviews as specified by the client. Maintaining and developing candidate databases and trackers. Responsible for articulating and negotiating job offers with candidates and clearly communicating all aspects of the offer including the salary, benefits, bonuses, relocations, etc. Follow-up with candidates for Post-Employment Reference Checks, Notice Period Negotiations, etc. till joining. Achieving the assigned target as per the role. Develop and maintain tie-ups with industry-specific organizations for building new alliances. Desired Candidate Profile The incumbent should have excellent communication skill and passion for building career in the field of recruitment.

column2: Responsibilities: 1. Recruitment and Talent Acquisition:  Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, resume screening, interviewing, and offer negotiations.  Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent.  Build and maintain a talent pipeline for current and future staffing needs. 2. Employee Relations:  Serve as a trusted advisor to management and employees on HR-related issues.  Resolve employee concerns and conflicts in a fair and timely manner.  Promote a positive work environment and foster employee morale. 3. Performance Management:  Implement and oversee performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and feedback mechanisms.  Provide coaching and guidance to managers on performance management best practices. 4. HR Administration:  Oversee HR administrative functions including payroll, benefits administration, and HRIS management.  Ensure compliance with relevant labor laws and regulations.  Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation. 5. Culture and Engagement:  Lead initiatives to promote employee engagement and foster a positive company culture.  Organize team-building activities, employee recognition programs, and other events to enhance morale Qualifications:

column2: As a HR Recruiter, you'll play a pivotal role in our team's recruitment efforts. Your responsibilities include:   Manage and organize smooth interviews for candidates.   Work closely with hiring managers to understand their needs.   Oversee recruitment and be the main contact for candidates and hiring managers. Improve the recruitment process for efficiency.   Conduct Interviews coordinate with operations teams for recruitment alignment.   Source and expand our candidate pool through online platforms and networking.   Screen and Review resumes and conduct phone screenings. Give helpful feedback to candidates for a positive experience.   Manage onboarding and Guide new hires for a smooth start. Work with HR and teams for a better onboarding experience.   Source business opportunities and engage with clients for potential opportunities.   Collaborate with hiring managers and build strong relationships to understand staffing needs.  Help with workforce planning and solve staffing challenges. Your role isn't just about finding the right people. It's also about building relationships to grow JobsKart. As a vital part of our team, you'll shape our workforce and contribute to success.

column1: Join India's Most Dynamic Recruiting Organization AS A HR Recruiter
column2: Job Opportunity for Fresher: Recruiter at HBR in Kolkata WALKIN- HBR, DN2, SIGNET TOWER, UNIT 804 8TH FLOOR, COLLEGE MORE SECTOR V  SALTLAKE KOLKATA - 700091 Position Title: HBR Recruiter Salary- Upto 1.44LPA+ BENEFIT  Role Overview: As an HBR Recruiter, you'll play a pivotal role in nurturing HBR's internal career growth culture. Your responsibilities will involve overseeing internal placements for immediate openings and cultivating internal succession pipelines. Collaborating with stakeholders is key to ensuring a seamless experience for all individuals engaging with HBR's hiring practices. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with external hiring recruiters to identify and fill open positions with qualified internal candidates. Drive the development of internal pipelines to support effective succession planning and talent mobility. Provide exceptional service to internal jobseekers. Influence positive change and encourage the adoption of HBR best practices among business leaders and their teams. Maintain accurate data integrity and cleanliness to support reliable analytics. Contribute to enhancing operational processes to improve efficiency, quality of hires, and overall employee experience ratings. Desired Profile: Requirements: Fresh graduates are preferred for this role. Demonstrated proficiency in executing and improving recruiting processes. Proven success in influencing change with business leaders and stakeholders. Strong track record of establishing effective working relationships with cross-functional teams. Exceptional organizational skills, meticulous attention to detail, and prompt responsiveness. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in MS Office Suite. Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) is advantageous, along with solid spreadsheet skills. Minimum of a Graduate degree or evidence of exceptional ability. Location: Kolkata This opportunity offers a platform for fresher professionals to kick-start their career journey as a recruiter, contributing to HBR's internal growth culture while gaining valuable experience and skill development. If you meet the requirements and are passionate about shaping careers, we encourage you to apply. CALL WHATSAPP -  9007152578

column2: Collection Development: The librarian is responsible for developing, selecting, and managing the librarys collection of books, journals, and other materials, ensuring that it is up-to-date and meets the needs of the community.      Cataloging and Classification: The librarian catalogs and classifies materials using standardized systems, making them easy to find and access for library users.      Reader Services: The librarian provides reader services to patrons, including reference assistance, readers advisory, and book recommendations, as well as providing assistance in navigating library resources.      Library Programs: The librarian plans and executes programs and activities for the community, including events such as book clubs, writing workshops, and author visits.      Information Literacy: The librarian educates library users on how to access and evaluate information, and assists them in developing research skills.      Communication and Language Skills: The librarian communicates effectively with patrons and staff, using strong English language skills. They may conduct read-alouds to promote literacy and language development among library users.      Library Administration: The librarian manages the daily operations of the library, including overseeing staff, developing policies and procedures, and ensuring the library is in compliance with all relevant regulations.      Technology: The librarian is proficient in using technology to manage the librarys operations, including the library management system, digital resources, and other technologies used by patrons and staff. They also help patrons use technology and access digital resources.      Preservation: The librarian is responsible for preserving library materials, including books, photographs, and other media, and may also provide guidance on the preservation of personal collections.      Community Outreach: The librarian is an advocate for the library within the community, building relationships with local organizations and promoting the librarys resources and services. They may also provide library services and programming to outreach sites such as schools and community centers.
